programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean and Teddy have no plans, so decide to stay in bed all day. Mr Bean is determined that his feet can’t touch the ground, so he pushes the bed around with a broom. He has to find ingenious ways to make his tea and toast for breakfast, brush his teeth and an even bigger challenge of ordering a pizza and collecting it from downstairs without getting out of bed!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: After seeing the flashy electric go-kart Mr Paliwal has bought for his daughter Divya, Mr Bean and Billy build their own using items around Mrs Wicket’s garden. At the go-kart track, Mr Bean and Mr Paliwal are unimpressed with Billy and Divya’s driving skills so take the karts for a “proper” race around the park. Meanwhile Mrs Wicket is on the warpath when she finds things missing from her house.

programme.title: Lu And The Bally Bunch - Shorts

programme.desc: Its Priyas birthday, so the gang is looking for something special as a gift for her. Ella suggests a birthday star, which is a star that is the same light years away as your age.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Ella stretches the truth a bit when she tells Angelie she can comet surf. She decides to try but finds its a lot harder than it looks. Slippy adds rockets to an asteroid so Ella can practice on that instead.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Slippy needs iron to fix his spaceracer. Ella tows him to a metal asteroid where Glitch is instructed to cut off a small piece. But when Ella distracts him, he accidentally cuts the asteroid into two large pieces! Ella feels responsible

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Ella is excited to get her own room but Tilly is not as thrilled. She asks Slippy if he can make her a time machine to slow down time so tomorrow never comes. Slippy says the only place time shows down is around black holes.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Ella has her best idea yet for a fun day. They will visit a nebula for each member of the family! Up first is Bernard 68, but it is very dark and frightens Tilly. When Dads truck breaks down, they head to the Boomerang nebula.

programme.title: Barneys World - Meet Barney

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy finds a white bear that fell out of a zoo’s refrigerated truck. After consulting the encyclopedia, he realizes that he and the bear are brothers of the same species! He decides to follow the encyclopedia’s instructions to the letter and take care of his brother during his hibernation. This runs counter to all of the Lemmings favorite activities. The Lemmings decide to create a false encyclopedia page which says that they too are bears. Grizzy is now obliged to treat them like brothers as well.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings’ hard rock concert is driving Grizzy mad. After kicking them out, Grizzy requisitions their ghetto blaster and listens to a relaxation cassette to calm down. The Lemmings discover an ancestral tree whose engraved strips of bark cast targeted maledictions. To recover their material, the Lemmings decide to drive Grizzy out by cursing him with the Ten Plaques of the Savanna.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy finds a giant home cinema screen.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings find a mask that terrifies anyone who looks at it.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: When Snowy and Jestah team up to execute a mysterious plan involving rare freeze-berries, Batwing and Buff pair up to take on the dastardly duo, but Batwing decides to carry out the mission herself, putting both her and Buff at risk.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: When all of the Batwheels (except for Bam) mysteriously disappear, Bam enlists the help of A.D.A.M, the original Batmobile, to help save his friends. programme.desc: Mr Bean discovers being in hospital isnt always a bed of roses.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean buys an expensive dress for Irma which he plans to return - so has to protect it from damage.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean is tidying his flat and chucking out a load of old unwanted junk. Unfortunately during the big clear out Teddy accidentally falls into a bin bag which gets put out in the street. Bean is horrified when the rubbish van arrives and he realises that dear old Teddy is now on his way to the landfill. Bean races across town to the dump but how will he ever find his friend amongst all the mountains of junk?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean buys a robot to clean his flat but it ends up trashing half the town.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean wants an ice cream from the ice cream van but ends up serving himself – along with every kid in town.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: In an accident during a chase, Lamput ends up getting stuck to Specs! Since they are literally inseparable, they bond over time until Boss commands Specs to return to the Lab.

programme.desc: Catastrophe strikes!! The Boss has a shaving accident that costs him his glorious Tache! It really stirs up some deep seated family issues for him.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy watches a documentary on salmon, whereas the Lemmings want to dance it up in the garage, nightclub style. TV versus music, the sonic war has begun!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: A confrontation between Grizzy and the Lemmings leads to a room in the castle tower. The bear accidentally sets off a mechanism and discovers a large medieval magic trunk.

programme.desc: An AI accidentally connects to Grizzy’s stuffed teddy bear, which comes to life.

programme.desc: When the Lemmings spoil Grizzys meal with their new game, the bear evicts them far from the cabin. They crash onto a faraway picnic table.

programme.desc: Jerry helps a Leprechaun retrieve the pot of gold that hes lost to Tom.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: A bouquet of flowers causes Tom no end of trouble.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Tuffy surprises Jerry with a visit from the actor who plays his favorite TV show character The Masked Mouse.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Pretending to be butterflies, Tuffy And Jerry cause all sorts of trouble in the house, until the Duke catches Tuffy with the intention of adding him to his butterfly collection.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: The Mice from Mars make a return visit and set about making mischief between Spike and Tom.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean buys an expensive dress for Irma which he plans to return - so has to protect it from damage.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean has got everything ready for Irma’s birthday; card cake candles but he just needs to get her some flowers. But nothing goes to plan as Mr Bean inadvertently causes a car crash involving a bride on her wedding day. There’s no time to lose as Mr Bean promises he’ll get the bride to the church on time. Irma is not a happy lady as Mr Bean is distracted by the task in hand.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean is keen to own a brand new smart phone when he discovers all the wonderful things it can do. But after a trip to the mobile phone shop he is horrified at how much they cost and decides to build his own one. Bean’s phone may be bulky but it comes with a whole range of built in gadgets especially useful during a race to The Tower of London.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: A clueless yet clever loner bungles his way through life in London. Mr Bean has some unexpected guests who think he runs a hotel!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean cannot, for the life of him, place the face of the uninvited fat bloke on his doorstep. An old school photograph and school cap just about jog his memory. By this time his new ‘friend’ has put his feet up and is eating Bean out of house and home. This blast from the past proves to be a blasted pain in the neck.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Irma Gobb watches TV with Mr Bean but his set explodes during an argument, leaving the hapless halfwit to invent his own form of home entertainment.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mrs Wicket has just inherited an antique grandfather clock – Mr Bean is impressed! But he soon starts to resent it when it bongs loudly on the hour all through the night. Desperate for sleep as dawn is breaking, he fiddles inside the clock, only for it to fall apart and onto the floor! Can he get the bulky heirloom to a repair shop and back before Mrs Wicket wakes up?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: From competitive eating to channeling his inner superhero, Mr. Bean’s bungling antics land him in all sorts of new sticky situations this season.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean accidently causes Mrs Wicket to be hospitalised and in need of a wheelchair. Back home Mr Bean has thoughtfully set up a bell service so that he can be at Mrs Wicket’s beck and call at any time of day or night. Mrs Wicket likes this...a lot. The bell doesn’t stop ringing and an exhausted Mr Bean finds himself running up and down the stairs carrying and fetching until he eventually loses patience with his patient.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean ends up on stage at the opera house...in a dress!

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: Lamput is stuck in the lab with a dangerous robot on the loose! Its up to the entire Lab team to save him before it is too late.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: Specs and the jewel thief have a lot in common. They are both round and blue. Also they both like accelerating into blind corners. A full-speed collision results in an accidental identity mixup - suddenly the thief finds himself with a real job at the Lab, and poor old Specs is being used as bedding by a hulking prison inmate. When Lamput decides to open up a can of kick-butt, the thief starts to wonder if a life of crime might be safer after all. Specs has no doubt at all where hed prefer to be. Lamput unveils a surprising skill at the kung-fu nerve-pinch. Specs is busted out of the clink, and returns to the life he loves: sprinting alongside his best bud Skinny, constantly failing to catch ol Lamput.

programme.title: Krypto Saves the Day!
programme.desc: Krypto embarks on a high-flying chase that creates major mayhem for a bus driver on his way to school.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: Chef Hector hires The Looney Builders to build him a burger restaurant, but Daffy is so focused on beating his handheld game.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders: Hard Hat Time
programme.desc: Bugs tries to play music for the crew on their lunch break, but his “boogie button” is busted.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Bam brings Catwomans Catmobile, Kitty, to life so the Batwheels can have even teams for their game of "Bat-Ball," but the Kitty "Kitty" is too wild to be contained, despite Bams best attempts to convince her to play along.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Everyone assumes that Harley Quinn is the culprit in a recent burglary. But as Batman and Bam pursue Harley, Bibi and Redbird begin to suspect that she may actually be innocent.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: The gang travels to Britain in 1843-ish and runs into Scrooge who claims he was attacked by the ghost of his partner Jacob Marley and that three more ghosts are coming. The gang agrees to solve the mystery but Velma wonders if she has more potential than just solving mysteries.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: A very bad parking choice on Freds part leads the gang to an asteroid mining base in outer space where an alien virus appears to be infecting the crew one by one, turning them into evil skull-headed aliens. The paranoid, terrified gang must try to solve the mystery before the virus reaches them, as well – if it hasnt already!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean is at the supermarket when he spots a cool fire engine ride – but the security guard makes it clear it’s for little kids only. Not to be deterred, Mr Bean tries everything he can to distract the guard to have his go on the ride. When he finally does get his go, it’s not as good as he thought it would be, especially when a real fire engine has to be called to help Mr Bean!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean tries to watch TV with Teddy, but as he tries to find the remote, lots of springs come out of his sofa, prompting him to buy a new sofa. Since he cannot afford a new sofa costing £300, Bean decides to have a yard sale. Eventually, he sells a stamp for £300 to a passerby and then buys the sofa. However, Bean soon realises that his TV remote is still inside the old sofa.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: The hapless halfwit finds a treasure map in a dusty corner of his attic, but the road to riches proves a rocky one.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean is furious with the untidy state of the streets and all the people who drop litter so he goes on a one-man mission to clean up the town. Armed with several bin bags Mr Bean collects all the rubbish and puts up his own ‘No Littering’ signs - which have absolutely no effect. When the police show no interest in his campaign Bean builds a homemade vacuuming contraption causing chaos and mayhem wherever he goes.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings lay hands on an ancient console, and Grizzy is transported into the game.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy has anticipated everything for his birthday and plans on spending a peaceful day in the cabin doing his favorite activities. But when the Lemmings find out it’s Grizzy’s birthday, they devise other plans. Farewell, Grizzy’s peaceful day - make way for the Lemmings’ party surprises!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings find a magic stick that functions as a Yummy divining rod. Grizzy steals their stick and finds a Yummy deposit in the savanna. To take control over Grizzy’s discovery, the Lemmings set a trap to draw the bear far from the deposit and transform it into an industrial chocolate factory. Grizzy will want to recover his chocolate deposit.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: An eclipse prevents the solar panels from supplying the cabin with electricity and Grizzy is disgruntledbecause he can’t watch TV. The Lemmingshappen upon a jewel that gives them total control over the fireflies.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings recover a jar of Yummy from an automatic distributor but before they can enjoy it Grizzy confiscates the treat. In exchange, he leaves them the keyring that came as a gift. The Lemmings aren’t interested until the keyring lands in a magic vial which gives it an extraordinary power: stick the keyring onto any object and it will shrink to the size of a plastic miniature figurine!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Nutty Hill is suffering from a stifling heat wave. Grizzy decides to get into the fridge, where the temperature will be more bearable, but the shelves are already full of Lemmings.

programme.desc: The Heroes must retrieve a Kazoom fragment before the Villains do.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: The gang’s trip to be bayou is ruined by a shambling Swamp Beast that’s scaring away anyone who dares to enter it’s soggy domain!

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: The gang hits the ski slopes, but the fun is soon interrupted by the appearance of an evil Snowman Monster eager to scare all trespassers off his mountain.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: Specs and Skinny spruce themselves up and head out to a piano concerto in the royal concert hall. Theyre on their best behavior, until they spot a fellow culture vulture who also happens to be small, orange and squishy. Honestly, theyre letting all sorts of rabble into these places these days. The Docs decide that a sleeping potion might be a quick and quiet way of capturing Lamput. Naturally things get out of hand, and when the entire audience catches a whiff of the snoozy brew, we find out exactly how hard it is to stay awake during a classical music recital. One star.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean accidentally swaps trunks with a magician with magical results!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean doesn’t like sharing the local soft play centre with a load of rowdy kids – so he goes home and builds his own house of fun.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: As Mr Bean settles down to watch his favourite TV programme he hears loud noises from next-door. He moves from house to garden but can’t escape the relentless cacophony of trumpets, electric drills, and screaming babies. Bean’s mind turns to thoughts of revenge….

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy dreams of drinking some nice cold coconut milk on the couch. Step one, get rid of the Lemmings who are having fun flying through the living room. Two, find coconuts that havent been emptied of their nectar. While Grizzy struggles to pick coconuts that are too high up, the Lemmings find a magic conch. By simply dusting yourself with its sand, you can fly! It doesnt take Grizzy long to figure this out and the bear rapidly imagines himself as Peter Pan sipping on his easily-harvested coconut milk.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy wants to watch TV in peace. The Lemmings have other plans: they want to have fun playing music with homemade instruments. Exasperated by the racket theyre making in the garage, Grizzy destroys the instruments and sends the Lemmings flying. The Lemmings discover a magic ukulele that bewitches anyone who hears its music: the perfect tool to regain control of the cabin and get back to their concert.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy cant sleep because its too hot. He decides to confiscate the fans the Lemmings use to power their fake spaceship. Totally into their Space Opera game, the Lemmings try to repel the alien Grizzy with "laser" party favors and are propelled onto an "unknown planet": a volcano crater with a secret base where a rocket is ready to take off. The rocket carries the cabin into space. Its no longer a game: Grizzy and the Lemmings will have to face the dangers of outer space!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy uses insecticide and a fly swatter to get rid of vermin that are bothering him during his siesta. The Lemmings heal his last victim: a cute little insect they adopt as their house pet. Only problem, their starving mascot only eats wood! The cabin has lots of it, but when Grizzy realizes that an insect is eating his home from the inside, he takes drastic measures to eliminate it permanently.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy asks the Lemmings to play with a baby ostrich found outside in exchange for their ventilator.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy has played for too many hours on the console. His eyes are so fatigued he cannot stand a single ray of light. The Lemmings choose this very moment to throw a big birthday party with as many lights as possible! Grizzy goes to great lengths to settle the issue and decides to trip the power supply. The Lemmings discover a source of magical light deep in the savanna.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show

Tom happily obliges, as Alfreds successful weight loss guarantees him a cushy spot upstairs. Meanwhile, Jerry aims to sabotage Toms efforts.

programme.desc: The Lady of the Houses cousins, the Van der Snoots, visit with their prize-winning Persian cat, Prancy Van der Snoot. programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: The Docs run out of puff and decide to cut some corners. All it takes is a sharpie, as it happens; just change a wanted poster to offer a huge reward, and bingo! The public are gonna do your work for you. Weirdly quickly, a hard-boiled granny shows up with Lamput under her arm. Things turn ugly when she actually expects to be paid the reward. Most unreasonable. Not even an odd-jobs montage can pay this giant bill; the Docs get desperate and turn to crime, which works about as well for them as it usually does. Specs and Skinny end up in the clink, the granny pockets a heap of cash, and Lamput is yet again the one that got away.

programme.desc: Badcomputer captures Bibi and disguises Jestah to take her place with the Batwheels so that Jestah can steal the Batcomputer’s motherboard. Can Bibi get free in time to unmask the imposter and save the day?

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: To escape a snowstorm, the gang checks into a creepy, massive hotel run by a man very strict about the hotel rules established by his deceased mother.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: The gang tours an old Hollywood Studio, but they soon uncover a mystery concerning the ghost of a silent film comedy star who has returned to make sure his recently discovered final film is never seen!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean receives a delivery of a bunch of flowers for Mrs Wicket, but accidentally runs them over in the his car. He can’t afford to replace them, so he decides to recreate the bunch by taking flowers one by one from anywhere he can - a vase in a cafe, a wedding bouquet, even from between the teeth of a tango dancer! But will he assemble the bunch and be back in time for Mrs Wicket?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: After a regrettable episode involving his landlady sleepwalking into his room, Mr. Bean suddenly finds himself out on his ear with nowhere to live. Near to tears, he yearns for the cosy familiarity of his old home. A scarecrow and a pair of false teeth come to his rescue.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean thinks back to the summers at scout camp in his youth. He goes camping for a night with Teddy, but buying a tent is difficult.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean has to deal with an unwanted house guest but the stubborn pest refuses to leave.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: Its back to basics as Specs attempts to catch Lamput with a net. Not being much good at anything at all physical, Specs ends up whacking himself on his own noggin. The blow shakes loose what little ability Specs had to function as an adult. Hes transformed into a wailing infant who requires 24 hour care from his devoted... parents? Skinny and Lamput have to learn on the job. Taking care of a baby is hard. Especially if its a giant annoying one.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings catch a grasshopper that can give you whatever your heart desires.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy creates a new Yummy-based recipe: Choco-noodles.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy is frustrated: just as he was about to coat a nice big fresh salmon with chocolate spread and snuggle up in front of the TV he discovers that the pantry is empty!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzys nap is interrupted by an annoying vibration. He sees the forest rangers cell phone on the couch.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Freed by the thawing ice, a mysterious giant egg slides up to the front door of the log cabin.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: In order to seduce the she-bear hes infatuated with, Grizzy decides to take things in hand and slim down with the rangers bodybuilding equipment.

programme.title: SuperThings: Rivals of Kaboom - Kazoom Power
programme.desc: Three New Kazoom Kids—friends of Finn, Kai, and Mia—appear unexpectedly in Kaboom City.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Monsters and ghouls get in the way of the Scooby gangs adventures as they travel and spend time together in the summer.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Monsters and ghouls get in the way of the Scooby gangs adventures as they travel and spend time together in the summer.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: The Docs prove their inventing skills by coming up with an age-altering time-ray. This breakthrough could change the world. If they used it for something other than chasing Lamput. Obsessed much, fellas? Wildly shooting their time-ray off in public causes a not-unsurprising amount of chaos, until the local law enforcement gets caught in the cross-fire. Looks like the Specs and Skinny are gonna be in jail till they get old the normal way.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean receives a delivery of a bunch of flowers for Mrs Wicket, but accidentally runs them over in the his car. programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean’s pizzas are a huge success with everyone – well almost everyone.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean needs a new passport photograph and goes to incredible lengths to get one.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean discovers being in hospital isnt always a bed of roses.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings have organized a mega party at the cabin. This is obviously not to Grizzy’s liking and the bear throws them out. The Lemmings discover a cave where the party is even more fun, but their ruckus drives out the bats who seek refuge in the cabin. Terrified of them, Grizzy tries everything to get rid of them and understands that the most effective thing is the Lemmings’ ghetto blaster.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings activate the air conditioners AI, causing it to fall in love with the fridge

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy finds a white bear that fell out of a zoo’s refrigerated truck. After consulting the encyclopedia, he realizes that he and the bear are brothers of the same species! He decides to follow the encyclopedia’s instructions to the letter and take care of his brother during his hibernation. This runs counter to all of the Lemmings favorite activities. The Lemmings decide to create a false encyclopedia page which says that they too are bears. Grizzy is now obliged to treat them like brothers as well.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings’ hard rock concert is driving Grizzy mad. After kicking them out, Grizzy requisitions their ghetto blaster and listens to a relaxation cassette to calm down. The Lemmings discover an ancestral tree whose engraved strips of bark cast targeted maledictions. To recover their material, the Lemmings decide to drive Grizzy out by cursing him with the Ten Plaques of the Savanna.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Inspired by a magazine, Grizzy decides to redo the cabin’s interior design. To make sure everything is perfect, he ousts the Lemmings and their electric train. By chance, the Lemmings discover an underground futuristic premises in the middle of the savanna. From this secret place, they can see the entire savanna on a giant screen, down to the very inside of Grizzy’s cabin just like in a sandbox video game. By using the menus, they can have an impact on reality and thus... on Grizzy!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings find a magic stick that functions as a Yummy divining rod. Grizzy steals their stick and finds a Yummy deposit in the savanna. To take control over Grizzy’s discovery, the Lemmings set a trap to draw the bear far from the deposit and transform it into an industrial chocolate factory. Grizzy will want to recover his chocolate deposit.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: An eclipse prevents the solar panels from supplying the cabin with electricity and Grizzy is disgruntledbecause he can’t watch TV. When he discovers that the Lemmings are using fireflies to have a party withoutelectricity, Grizzy evicts the Lemmings and recovers the fireflies to fuel the solar panels. The Lemmingshappen upon a jewel that gives them total control over the fireflies.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Batwing and Goldie secretly decide to participate in the Gotham Air-Show, but when Batman needs their help, they must choose between winning the competition and their responsibilities to fight crime.

programme.title: Batwheels

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: MOE creates a new, super sparkly vehicle paint!

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: To ease the burden on MOE, the Batwheels use his duplicating machine to make copies of their repair bot, but the Batcave is soon overrun when the machine breaks!

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: When the Looney Builders build themselves a playground, Daffy gets so excited about his section that he takes all the supplies for himself.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: Mac and Tosh Gopher hire the Looney Builders to build an underground home. Daffy is unable to remove rocks from the area fast enough.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: Bizzy Buzzards mom hires the builders to build a nest.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: The Looney Builders are hired by Hoots Talon to expand and paint the old library.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Tom falls asleep inside a rolled-up carpet left out on the curb by Rick with a "free" sign attached. When the new owners unload their pickup truck and leave the carpet in front of their home, a sleepy Tom doesnt notice at first that everything is similar to, but a little different than, his usual surroundings. Soon Tom feels that hes landed in bizarro world.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: After a series of beatings from Tom, Jerry storms off into his mouse hole. Soon he falls asleep and dreams himself to be the Lord of Downton Abbey! Tom is now servant to Lord Jerry, and the Master wastes no time in making Toms life miserable. Tom is caught in the act of exacting revenge, so Lord Jerry challenges Tom to a duel in the dream world.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Jerry is feeling lonely and wishes he had a girlfriend. Spike explains spring fever to Tom and they leave him be. Jerrys mood improves when he gets a message from his brawny cousin Muscles, who has fixed him up with his girlfriends friend for a double date.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: When Jerrys country cousins visit the Abbey, the cook is convinced Downton is in the midst of a vermin invasion! Cates (the butler) presses Tom into service with the threat of becoming a stable cat otherwise. Tom pursues the cunning, feisty bumpkins, and Jerry, throughout the manor, and they delight in making surprise appearances to Tom in awkward moments.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Jerry discovers the mysterious phobia cats have toward cucumbers and is inspired to try it out on Tom. After freaking Tom out repeatedly, Butch steps in to counsel Tom and help him overcome his fear, only Butch is far from immune himself. The two encounter more and more trouble as they deal with their phobia.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: A dim-witted cat walks into the detective agency asking for help. It seems he has lost his marbles: Hes the citys champion marble player and has either misplaced his case of lucky marbles, or its been stolen. The cat is desperate to find them before the big tournament. Its up to Tom and Jerry to retrace the cats steps and solve this mystery.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: When Ella heads out to collect some space materials for the Clubhouse, she borrows Slippy’s luckiest good luck charm, Mooncake. But when Ella arrives at a black hole, Mooncake is bumped off her Moonscooter into the strong gravity of the black hole.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: It’s Ella’s mom’s birthday! Determined to get her mom the bestest birthday gift ever, Ella searches the Galaxy with help from her friends. But with time running out, she’ll have to realize that the best gift of all may not come wrapped in a box...

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: When a prized possession goes missing, Slippy’s sure the mysterious Alien Silicon Jellyfish took it! Ella’s pretty sure the Jellyfish doesn’t exist... but as the gang hunts for it, Ella learns that supporting her friend is what matters most!

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: On the eve of Dad opening his museum of human artifacts on the moon, Ella and Slippy help him by “fixing” a lunar rover until it drives off, with Glitch on board! Determined to fix this themselves, our gang understands it’s best to admit your mistake and ask for help.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: After an exciting race, Ella’s Dad gives her a mysterious Treasure Map of their solar system. It was Slippy’s dad who had given it to him when they were boys. They quickly figure out how to read the map and set off.

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Its spring, and Mole is whitewashing his burrow. His friends come to help while the watching weasels spy an opportunity to play a prank on them.

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Ratty takes his friends out for a boat trip and insists, as Captain, what he says goes. But when the boat is scuppered on the rocks, he finds that listening to his friends is the way to save the day.

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: When Toad resolves to live the simple life and camp by the riverbank, the weasels take the opportunity to take over Toad Hall. Can Toad now ever return?

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Toad enlists his friends to help him make a superhero movie, but his overbearing ego means they soon leave him to his own devices. But when the Weasels trick him, he finds himself in a pickle without his friends to help.

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Hedge tries out Toad’s new power kite and gives the Weasels an idea of how to get into Toad Hall.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series

Bean reluctantly agrees, but when he sees Mr Paliwal finish a personal training session and keen for more, he offers him a new workout… doing all Mr Bean’s work for him while he watches the racing! Win, win!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: In a trampoline park, Bean competes in a race with a boy. The winner gets Teddy. Will Bean and Teddy be separated forever?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series

programme.title: The Agenda
programme.desc: A weekly talk-show looking beyond the headlines and “accepted wisdom” to find the real story. Hosted by award-winning journalist and presenter Stephen Cole, The Agenda quite simply sets The Agenda . You won’t find the same-old talking heads recycling platitudes; instead thought-provoking guests to debate and explore key issues of today’s world. Using virtual reality graphics to bring subjects to life, Stephen will navigate through subjects ranging from “Prove That Climate Change Exists” to “Who Will Win the Race to Space”. Opposing views will be given opportunity to flourish and develop into a meaningful conversation. The Agenda: No nonsense talk; Challenging perceptions.

programme.title: The Universe
programme.desc: Without the moon, the earth would be a very different and desolate place today: four hours of sunlight with pitch-black nights, steady 100mph winds spawning giant hurricanes lasting for months, and virtually no complex life forms, much less humans.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts investigate the similarities in burial tombs from distant cultures, and question whether aliens could have influenced their complicated designs.

programme.title: Search For The Lost Giants
programme.desc: Brothers Jim and Bill Vieira discover a previously unknown hidden chamber where they believe a giant skeleton may be buried.

programme.title: Chasing Mummies
programme.desc: Zahi is determined to disprove the theories of the so-called pyramidiots, who believe that there are secret underground chambers leading to the Sphinx. Little did anyone know that these caves were home to thousands of bats!

programme.title: Engineering An Empire
programme.desc: For more than 500 years, Rome was the most powerful and advanced civilisation the world had ever known, built by an unprecedented mastery of engineering and labour.

programme.title: MonsterQuest
programme.desc: Investigators try to compile evidence to prove that the elusive monster known as sasquatch exists, including videos, tracks, prints and maps of sightings.

programme.title: Lost Worlds
programme.desc: The Har at Megiddo gave its name to Armageddon, the final battle described in the book of Revelation. Trace the history of the cities built on this hilltop.

programme.title: How The Earth Was Made
programme.desc: What are the enormous forces that generate catastrophic waves deep on the ocean floor? The 2004 Indian Ocean tsunami is estimated to have released the energy of 23,000 atomic bombs.

programme.title: Brad Meltzers Lost History
programme.desc: Host Brad Meltzer and viewers are on the hunt for lost and stolen history, including JFKs actual brain tissue and millions of dollars of gold coins stolen from the U.S. Mint. Plus, a remarkable violin from the Titanic.

programme.title: In Search Of Aliens
programme.desc: All around the world are examples of physical evidence suggesting humans are not alone in the universe, but has this evidence been left behind for a purpose? Is it a series of clues we are meant to decipher? Giorgio A Tsoukalos investigates.

programme.title: The Curse Of Civil War Gold
programme.desc: A daring diving operation produces potential evidence of some 140 million dollars in gold at the bottom of Lake Michigan, while an informant shares a 50-year-old secret that shocks and energises the team.

programme.title: In Search Of Aliens
programme.desc: In 1958, a bulldozer operator in California discovered 16-inch human-like footprints, and the legend of Bigfoot was born. Today, there are hundreds of reported sightings, but nowhere are the stories more prolific than in Americas Pacific Northwest.

programme.title: Hunting Hitler
programme.desc: With Peron toppled from power, Hitler and Bormann could have been forced to flee Argentina. Following leads from declassified files, Bob and John send the teams into Chile and Paraguay to investigate Hitlers whereabouts if he were forced to escape.

programme.title: The Universe: Ancient Mysteries Solved
programme.desc: Sodom and Gomorrah-a Biblical tale of two cities incinerated by a hail of fire and brimstone. Astronomers, archeologists and biblical scholars investigate the possible science behind the myth.

programme.title: Ross Kemp: Shipwreck Treasure Hunter
programme.desc: Ross tries to find out more about his sea-faring Great Grandfather, Arthur ‘Pop’ Chalmers. He discovers that Pop served in the Merchant Navy and survived three shipwrecks. Inspired to know more, he links up with maritime archaeologist, Mallory Haas.

programme.desc: After another year of incredible finds on Oak Island, Matty Blake gets the ultimate insiders scoop from Rick, Marty and their team.

programme.title: The Unxplained With William Shatner
programme.desc: How do some people live through the impossible, whether its plane crashes, bearing freezing temperatures, or performing superhuman feats while in danger?

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Things go nuclear when a Japanese Godzilla toy hits the counter. Can Corey come out on top before hes crushed? Next, Chum does battle over a leather jacket from WW2 - but will his offer bomb?

programme.desc: With technological advancements, humanity has entered a new era in the search for life outside of our planet. From the discovery of exoplanets and the exploration of the moon, could man’s quest to understand the universe be built into our DNA?

programme.desc: As the team begins drilling in the Mesa, where a massive, possibly metallic object is buried, they have a startling encounter.

programme.title: The Unxplained With William Shatner
programme.desc: Could a hoard of fantastic riches been hidden on a tiny island in the North Atlantic? And if such a treasure exists — who buried it?

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: When Chum sniffs out a 1920s Baccarat bottle for Ybry perfume, is an offer crystal clear, or does it make no scents? Then, Rick takes a look at a sealed copy of the Spiderman and Venom: Maximum Carnage video game. Will this deal have his spidey senses tingling, or is the seller spinning a web of lies? Meanwhile, Corey weighs the odds on a gambling kit from the 1800s. And later, Rick and Corey take a trip to the range to scope out an autocannon used during the attack on Pearl Harbor.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: When a customer soars into the shop with a rare H.G. Wells book - and an astronomical asking price - will Corey shoot for the stars? Next, theres no horsing around when a statue made of turquoise moseys on in. Will it be a yay, or a neigh for Rick?

programme.title: The Proof Is Out There
programme.desc: Did a Swedish teenager photograph some of the most convincing UFO evidence ever? Is a video posted online showing a pterodactyl-like creature flying over Idaho the real deal? Why are headless goats repeatedly being dumped in an Atlanta River?

programme.title: Historys Greatest Escapes With Morgan Freeman
programme.desc: Rene Belbenoit is sentenced to hard time at Frances notorious penal colony in French Guiana. He determines to escape or die trying. After numerous harrowing escapes, he finally gets free. His story becomes the basis of several movies in Hollywood.

programme.title: Historys Greatest Escapes With Morgan Freeman
programme.desc: Quawntay Adams, a young African American man from a South-Central Los Angeles gets caught up in a large-scale marijuana bust and is sentenced to a long prison term.

programme.title: The UnXplained With William Shatner
programme.desc: For centuries, mankind has created unbreakable codes to conceal valuable information. If these codes can be deciphered, could we unlock answers to some of historys greatest mysteries?

programme.title: Ancient Aliens: Ultimate Evidence
programme.desc: Giorgio Tsoukalos draws on evidence from past series as he asks whether aliens introduced the Greeks and Egyptians to electricity.

programme.title: The UnXplained With William Shatner
programme.desc: For centuries, mankind has created unbreakable codes to conceal valuable information. If these codes can be deciphered, could we unlock answers to some of historys greatest mysteries?

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: It’s a wet and gloomy day in the real world. Messy is watching from inside whilst the rain pours onto his sandcastle he built earlier, it begins to melt. “Why does it have to rain?” sighs Messy. He transports himself to Okido to find out. The weather couldn’t be hotter in Okido. He greets Zoe and Felix in the garden who can’t wait to show Messy their beautiful sunflowers before the Mayor of Okido comes judge them in the City in Bloom competition this afternoon.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: When a comedy of errors causes Orange, Plum and Cherry to arrive late to their campout, they start off their annual tradition of telling tall-tales around the campfire by making up three outrageous, hysterical accounts of what held them up.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry accidentally smashes his mums favourite china teacup.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry needs help making up a story to go with his new drawing.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Ranger Rocky entrusts the Junior Rangers with a mission—return a mola to the ocean! The Junior Rangers take up the challenge, but find themselves having to wing it when some seagulls start pecking the mola.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: When some of the engines think life would be easier without Diesel, he decides to teach them a lesson by hiding. But his plan backfires when none of the engines come looking for him! Diesel is painted with glow-in-the-dark paint and he plays a trick on the other engines... but Nia and Paxton surprise him in return!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Shane is having too much fun to stop and refuel; that is, until he runs out of coal and is stranded in the hot, red desert.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Grisu has to look after Thingy while his mistress Olivia is away. Grisu has to take the dog to the pet grooming shop to take a bath. But Thingy is a stubborn dog. He refuses to move forward. Grisu And Stella will have to use kindness and to be smart enough to drive the dog through the town. Without listening to his father Fume, who tries to make him use his dragon flame...

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: The shooting of the movie “The monster of the Valley”, directed by the famous Quintin Ratatino, is going badly. A fire has destroyed his mechanical monster and his film crew has deserted the scene. Grisu and Stella help to save the movie. Grisu takes on the role of the monster and Stella helps with the technique. But playing the main part in a Ratatino’s movie is not that easy, evenmore when the director asks Grisu to play the role... of a nasty dragon!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse innocently pick lots of Spring flowers from a field and deliver bunches to their friends. When they realise that they are being followed everywhere by a cloud of yellow butterflies, they realise that the butterflies need the flowers, to feed from their nectar. How will they lead the little butterflies to more flowers and sweet nectar?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One clear Spring night, Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse settle in to enjoy Little White Owl’s story of adventure and treasures. Inspired by her tale, the two set out to try and touch the most special treasure of all – a shiny star. They climb higher and higher but the beautiful stars seem just out of reach. Will they find a way to get their wish?

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Basil, who has promised Rosie to go with her to find a rare leaf, hears Scoutbadger doubting his ability to keep his promises. To reassure Rosie, Basil decides to do even better than his promise, he will bring his daughter the most beautiful of rare leaves. Unfortunatley, he has problems and cannot make the rendezvous. Rosie is disappointed. Scoutbadger realises that he should not have doubted Basil and repairs his mistake…

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob and the team arrive at the Racetrack to build three horse stables the day before a big race. At the sight of the horses, Leo goes into ‘cowboy mode’ for the duration of the build. Henry Corner, the anxious groom, wants the build to be as noise-free as possible for the sake of his nervy horses, which is exactly when the noisy Two-Tonne arrives in reverse. The build progresses well, until, getting carried away lassoing with some spare ropes, Leo scares the horses, who escape from their paddock and kick out at the nearly-built stables in their excitement. The stables collapse like dominos! Bob and Scoop have to round up the horses now galloping around the racetrack while Wendy’s quick thinking and Lofty’s help steers them back safely into their paddock. But the stables still need to be built all over again and now it’s nearly dusk. A contrite Leo thinks he may have a solution, but what?

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Roland’s Gifts is an internet gift shop; Bob, Leo, Scoop, Muck and Lofty are in its huge distrubution warehouse with owner, Roland Sweet. It’s a few days before Christmas and Roland has commissioned Bob and his team to install a hi-tech a robotic picking system, which will pick items off shelving, wrap them and put them into delivery vans via a chute. The system needs to be installed by evening the next day so customers receive their gifts in time for Christmas Day. Scoop and Muck are excited and do ‘robotic’ impressions; Leo claims to be very knowledgeable about robotics. During the installation Leo switches the system on to prove his knowledge to Scoop. Meanwhile an approaching snowstorm has moved the delivery deadline to that very evening.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Huckle and his pals all receive party invitations, but the partys location is a mystery. Small circular marks left behind by whoever delivered the invitations are an important clue. It leads Huckle and pals to Miss Honey whos been walking with a crutch. Grateful for the help she got raking up all her leaves, Miss Honey decided to throw a party for all the volunteers./Huckle and his pals discover a mysterious gigantic spoon.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Leo’s paper plane crashes into a young Malayan colugo. The Junior Rangers search the rainforest for the colugo’s mother, but the mission comes to a halt when they chance upon a forest fire. Will the Junior Rangers eventually succeed in their mission? Or will their plans go up in smoke?

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Leo meets an oriental pied hornbill while picking apples in his garden. To find the hornbill’s nest, the Junior Rangers set out for the rainforest once again.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: In the box of “RocoChoco” cereal, Simon is trying to get his hands on the toy at the bottom. It’s a “Chocosaurus”, a little, plastic dinosaur. Since he already has this one, Simon runs over to Ferdinand’s to give it to him. But when the door opens, Ferdinand is standing there with Mamadou, Simon’s other best friend. And he too, wants the “Chocosaurus”! The two friends blackmail him into…picking his best friend! Simon is faced with a heck of a dilemma: who should he give it to? Finally, thanks to Mom’s help, he understands that he doesn’t have to chose ONE best friend. He is going to make a couple of “Simonosauruses” for both friends, so each of them will have one!

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: At the end of summer, the Star Girl visits her friends. She rarely comes because her star-shaped house is in the sky. They spend a day together, and when night falls, the Star Girl bids everyone farewell. She can’t speak, but she plays the harp beautifully. The music will lift her house into the sky. However, this time one of the harp strings comes loose, and the house doesn’t rise. The Wind blows the string out of her hand, and she can’t catch it.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The Centipedes apple tree hasn’t had any fruit for many years. He asks Berry for help, who carefully tends to the tree. At the beginning of summer, apples finally appear, and the Centipede is so happy that he invites his distant relative, the Millipede, for a visit. However, the Millipede falls ill and can’t come. The Centipede then invites his friends to a big apple party. When they arrive, they pretend that the Millipede was there, but it turns out that it was just his friends in costume.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The Cave Spider and the tiny Spiderling are good friends, and one summer day they are walking on the mountaintop. Spiderling blows a dandelion at the Cave Spider, who falls and gets injured. Spiderling immediately seeks help from Doctor Owl, who determines that the Cave Spiders legs are bruised and prescribes two weeks of rest. Berry, Dolly, Stanley, and Balthazar help the Cave Spider get home. Dolly suggests they sew a large canopy so the Cave Spider can watch the ants end-of-summer fireworks from the air. Flutter, Leapy, Zephyr, and the others make the canopy, and on the night of the fireworks, they lift the Cave Spider up so he can enjoy the view from above.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: On a spring day, Alfonso finds an unknown seedling by the stream. The cricket carefully guards the plant, which soon produces a special flower. Alfonso waters and tends to it daily, happily watching it grow. One morning at the end of summer, Alfonso notices that the flower has wilted and its petals have fallen off. Sadly, he gathers the petals and brings them into the house. In the afternoon, Dolly visits him, and later his friends come over to cheer him up. They bring delicious pancakes, but Alfonso is still sad. They go out to the stream, and Alfonso scatters the flower petals into the water, bidding them farewell with tears.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: As the end of summer approaches, the Lightning Beetle visits the fireflies and surprises them with a new book about planets and stars. After a conversation, one little firefly, when the others were already asleep, sets out to conquer the sky, but becomes completely exhausted and crashes. Doctor Owl diagnoses him with a fever and possible pneumonia, so he stays with him to heal. The other fireflies decide to surprise him. With the help of Berry, Dolly, Balthazar, Stanley, Flutter, and Eddy, they make colourful orbs, and the Lightning Beetle crafts the Sun. They suspend the planets on a hoop, which Eddy rotates with a contraption. They also instal tiny lights, resembling stars.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Dolly goes for a walk, and finally she is enriched with a beautiful cherry and a good friend.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry the snailboy and Dolly the ladybird are the best friends ever. They’re having many pretty adventures in 3X13 short tales, while they make new friends and get knowledges about the world around them.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing falls in love with a lost dog he and Flop find in the park and decides he wants to keep her. When the owner turns up Bing is very upset when it comes to saying goodbye to his new friend.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: When the children make Eggy heads with eggs and cress seeds, Bing gets impatient and wants his cress to grow quicker so he decides to give Eggy lots of water with the garden hose.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The bunny gets jealous when Sula gives Pando more attention on a playdate. He tries to gain some for himself and ends up being pushed, so Amma show them how to get rid of the anger

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing is playing the talking lettuce game on Flops phone when he drops the phone and accidentally breaks it

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Edna asks Rupert to look after her sons Billy and Benny. No problem, thinks Rupert. They can play while he reads a book. But no sooner has Rupert sat down in his armchair than the little squirrels turn up with one request after another. First they want lunch, then they need to go to the loo, then they want to play.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Tilda is a clever and intelligent mouse who lives in a tiny house at the base of the church wall with her pet Snaily and her best friends.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Tilda is visited by her Great Great Aunt Emily. In honour of the occasion, all the friends have a game of Blind Mans Buff. Emily and Rupert have to take off their glasses. After the game, the two pairs of spectacles get mixed up and Emily and Rupert suddenly start suffering all manner of mishap: Rupert bites into an onion instead of an apple...

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: In Winter, Little Nutbrown Hare and his friends try to find an extra special place and extra special food for Feast Day celebrations. When things go awry and nothing seems special at all, they discover that the most important thing is to be able to celebrate with those you love. Theme: celebrating with those you love.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Can you guess how much I love you? Little Nutbrown Hare asks his father. Big Nutbrown Hare looks up at the big, old oak tree. As much as the Old Oak Tree is big? he asks. Little Nutbrown Hare holds up an acorn in triumph. No, as big as this acorn! He replies. Because this acorn will just keep growing and growing and growing.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One morning in the early Springtime, Little Nutbrown Hare wakes to find the air filled with a delightful smell. He and Little Field Mouse search all over the meadow, the woods and by the riverside to find the source of the wonderful smell. They discover all kinds of new and unexpected Spring scents… sweet, pretty and fresh, but will they find the one they are searching for?

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: Brewster learns about camouflage when he repaints the lizard’s house.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: In the lush Amazon Rainforest, explorer Peyos discovery of a rare orchid takes an unexpected turn when playful pygmy marmoset younglings snatch it away. Believing them to be babies, Peyo calls the Junior Rangers - Leo, Katie, and Hero who were in the Garden, having fun imitating dances with each other. The team learns about pygmy marmosets, the worlds smallest monkeys from the computer. Arriving in the Amazon, they help Peyo to reunite the younglings with their family but first, they have to catch them as they keep jumping away! A spirited chase ensues with Hero, Pico, and the Junior Rangers pursuing the mischievous monkeys. They stumble upon Ranger Rocky who successfully catches one of the monkeys. Ranger Joey shares valuable insights into pygmy marmoset behavior. They find the monkey family near a river by finding trees with holes in them caused by the monkeys. But suddenly, Peyo alerts Leo and Katie of the monkeys playing on a branch dangerously close to the river. The branch snaps but with swift action from Leo, the monkeys are saved and returned to their family. Back at the Treehouse, Leo calls it a mission accomplished and finds Katie dizzy from trying to imitate Hero chasing his tail.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Jayden explores a North American beach with a walking stick, encountering seals, and discovering a blind pup. Leo,Katie and Hero are playing Blind Mans Bluff in the Garden before getting a call from Jayden regarding the pup. From the computer, they learn about harbor seals and realize the pup may be lost since the mother is nowhere to be seen on the beach. Leo, Katie and Hero travel to the beach, where confusion arises about the pups behavior. They stumble upon Ranger Rocky who calls Ranger Joey as she clarifies the seal pups natural behavior, and Ranger Rocky suggests the mother might be finding food in the ocean. After the call with Ranger Joey, they can’t seem to find the pup! Concerned about the missing pup and Hero, the group splits up to search and eventually finds Hero playing Blind Man’s Bluff with the seal. Ranger Rocky surprises them as he shows them who he found, the pup’s mother returning from the ocean! Leo concludes the mission accomplished before joining Katie and Hero in another round of Blind Man’s Bluff.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: While out playing in the forest, T’choupi and Nina come across a broken bird’s egg. Wooow! Look at that: a little chick has literally just been born! But wait a minute: this particular egg is blue, and as far as they know, birds don’t lay blue eggs… Could it be from another type of animal?? And if so, which one? Super excited, T’choupi and Nina start searching for the mysterious creature that laid this blue egg…

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Today, T’choupi and his friends, Nina and Luce, must help Fred take his goats to a field a certain distance away. But when Loupiote the dog gets wounded and is unable to shepherd the goats, the kids are very disappointed. Until, all of a sudden, they get a brilliant idea: why don’t they stand in for Loupiote and play shepherd dog, to guide the goat herd to the grazing field?...!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: When T’choupi and Nina find out there’s going to be a star shower visible in the sky tonight, they get very excited, and determined not to miss it! But they’re going to have to persuade their parents in order for that to happen… Not an easy feat: they’re way too young to stay up so late…

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: It’s the day of the school fair and amidst all the excitement, Charley forgets Mimmo at the "Toy Swap" stand! It is therefore assumed that Mimmo is one of the stand toys available for swapping… so a mother offers Mimmo to her little baby boy. When Charley comes to realize this, he is heart-broken: what if Mimmo really had disappeared… forever?!!

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Julia realizes that, despite her efforts to fit in, she will never share all the memories the children have made living in the Mouse Mansion. Sam will help her overcome this difficulty.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam and Julia dream of seeing snow falling in the yard of the Mouse Mansion. They decide to do everything they can to make this happen. But such a thing is not so simple, as they will find out!

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Arriving from a faraway island, Julia the little mouse moves into a new home with her mother. There she meets Sam, another young mouse whos long lived with his parents and a whole gang of brothers and sisters. They quickly become inseparable and enjoy a host of fun adventures together.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: A delivery of pipes is being unloaded at Brendam Docks. But the engines start to hear scary spooky noises and soon Salty has them all convinced that it’s the sound of the Flatbeds of Fear. Only Emily insists that there must be a sensible explanation, until she hears the sound herself and gets frightened. But it turns out Emily was right about their being a sensible explanation. The sound was just air blowing over the pipes!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Paxton likes to be friends with everyone, diesels and steamies alike, but it’s not easy to be friends with Diesel. Diesel gives Paxton a terrible fright when he makes him think that all the other diesels have disappeared. He hides and races away from Paxton. But when Diesel runs out of fuel, it is Paxton who takes him by surprise by offering him help. Paxton gives him a push to the fuel tank, and a taste of what friendship might be like.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: On a rainy day, while Mommy is out and Daddy is working, Caillou andRosie struggle with boredom. On a suggestion from Daddy, Caillou andRosie use crayons and their imagination to make their own fun, and tellthe story of Mommys epic quest to bring home pizza for their dinner.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou wants to be just like the Red Racer on TV - but hes tooyoung to drive a real car... Luckily, Mommy can build Caillou hisvery own Go-Kart!

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Red spots suddenly begin appearing on everything in Busytown from Mr. Rabbit’s mail box to Hilda Hippo’s roof! Huckle ultimately discovers that the red spots are really juice marks made from cherries falling from overhanging trees. / A teeny weeny piano motivates Huckle, Sally and Lowly to try to figure out who would own such a small instrument.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Parrot is drinking his afternoon tea when he discovers Monkey building a bizarre looking extension to the tree house that soon enough falls apart... Mole appears and explains how the beaver is such an amazing builder... they decide to venture to the lake to learn from the beaver. Watching beaver work inspires a fun game of Monkey See Monkey Do!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: When James and Sarah compete for the title of best steam driver, James accidentally spills a burning coal into a pile of wood, sparking a fire.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: When Charlie takes the kids on a sailing lesson, he feels upstaged by Peter and a seagull. As Charlie tries to win back the kids’ attention, he ends up sinking the boat. / Fireman Sam and the rest of the team are training Mike Flood and Charlie Jones to be reserve firemen and Station Officer Steele is very pleased with their progress.

programme.title: Franklin And Friends
programme.desc: When the Super Cluepers discover an old magnifying glass that seems to have belonged to some junior detectives, they set off to find out more about these mysterious detectives. When Big Nutbrown Hare spots his son from way across a grassy field everyone realizes that Little Nutbrown Hare’s little tail is clever in its own way.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One Summer’s day Little Field Mouse is very excited to show Little Nutbrown Hare her new favourite thing, a very pretty flower… the prettiest ever! She lets Little Nutbrown Hare borrow it to show Big Nutbrown Hare, but when it blows away during the night Little Nutbrown Hare worries how his friend will react. programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: Kipper and Tiger are having great fun with the hosepipe and paddling pool. Unfortunately Tiger didnt attach the hosepipe to the tap properly and suddenly theres water everywhere.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature

programme.title: Sam And Julia

programme.desc: The Triplets each receive surprise packages with little instruments, but Poet and Turbulent are quite jealous of Girl’s pretty trumpet. programme.title: The Triplets

He is so sulky and rude that the Fat Controller leaves him in his shed. Eventually James apologises and the Fat Controller gives him some work to do, but when James discovers that he’s pulling waste trucks he starts sulking again and it is only when his friends help him laugh at himself that James finally manages to find a way to dowhat he has to do, and even enjoy it!

After explaining the situation, the Junior Rangers agrees to help and travel to meet with Kai. Once they arrive, Leo is surprised how cold the environemnt is. Katie gives him an extra scarf and gloves. The Junior Rangers then meet up with Kai and the camel has a large rock stuck in its toes. Kai has an idea to use his grabber. Katie holds the leg as Leo tries to distract the animal while Kai pulls the rock out. Kai manages to success pull it out and Katie immediately disinfact the camels foot. The Junior Rangers then wants to reunite camel with its caravan, and they follow the camel who has already walk away. It was troubling for the Junior Rangers as the sand dune is hard to manuever. programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare follows some unusual tracks in the snow that eventually lead him to a shy little spotty deer. programme.desc: It is raining a lot outside and the Triplets are bored. "Only people who have no imagination get bored", says Mom. programme.title: The Triplets

The Mayor isn’t upset though; she thinks that Koko’s trip around Chuggington was fantastic and it should become a regular tour.

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D)
programme.desc: Caillou feels frustrated when Rosie solves all the scavenger hunt clues at Grandma and Grandpa’s beach house. In fantasy, Caillou pretends to be a pirate captain on a sinking ship who learns the importance of listening to his team.

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D)
programme.desc: Caillou doesn’t like Daddy’s chicken dinner, and he says so with a “Yuck!” Going into fantasy, Caillou pretends to be the Silver Knight, cooking a meal for a very picky King (Daddy), and the experience teaches him to express his dislike for something in a more polite way.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: James hears Duck talking about the slip coaches they used on the Great Western Railway, which could be uncoupled at stations without stopping, and presents it to the Fat Controller as his idea - but he soon runs into trouble.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: On a beach in Indonesia, Zari finds tide pools littered with rubbish and a stranded bamboo shark in one of the tide pools. In the Garden, Leo is engrossed in a cricket hunt but finds the cricket on top of a slide which Hero tries to climb up. They get a call from Zari as she tells them about the shark and its inability to climb up the tide pool wall. As they arrive, Leo attempts to scoop the shark out, but the shark ends up slipping away. Katie recalls that bamboo sharks can crawl on their fins. The team fills the tide pool to facilitate the sharks escape, only to encounter another hurdle—rubbish-filled tide pools blocking its way to the sea. Ranger Rocky intervenes, and calls Ranger Joey who shares insights into the bamboo sharks ability to survive out of the water for long periods of time. The team cleans the tide pools, ensuring a safe passage for the bamboo shark back to the sea. Back at the treehouse, Leo hangs a picture of the bamboo shark as Hero slides down the slide with the cricket on his head.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Farah discovers a mysterious jar containing a sparkly squid while cleaning her dirt bike at a Singaporean beach. Meanwhile, in the Hero Garden, Katie initiates a complex treasure hunt for Leo that ends with an unexpected twist—a new map inside a treasure chest. The rangers receive an emergency call from Farah, who finds the squid changing colors inside the jar. Concerned for the squids well-being, they consult the computer, and identifies the squid as a Bigfin Reef Squid. The team rushes to the beach, where Leo accidentally throws the jar into the ocean in an attempt to open it. They try to grab the jar into the ocean but to no avail when suddenly Ranger Rocky grabs it from underwater! They retrieve the jar but find the squid in a seemingly lifeless state. Ranger Joeys insights reveal that the squid is likely in shock and needs a dark, cool environment to recover. The rangers transport the squid to the ocean floor near a coral reef, witnessing its vibrant transformation and ensuring it finds a safe home. Back in the Treehouse, Leo hangs a photo of the Bigfin Reef Squid, and in the Garden, Katie gets frustrated as all the treasure chests she finds only have been full of maps.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: If youre very quiet and statue still, then the duckies will come. Today, Bing and Sula are at the park to feed the ducks. Bing, on the other hand, throws all the food into the water at once – not thinking that a big quacking goose will come along and eat it all in one bite!

programme.title: Bing Bunny

programme.desc: On a very windy day in Big City, Oswald and Weenie volunteer to look after baby Catrina while Madame Butterfly goes back to the Diner for her blanket. Oswald buys a balloon as a present for Catrina but a strong wind carries Catrina and the balloon off high into the sky! Oswald and Weenie commandeer a hot air balloon to try and catch Catrina who flies further and further away from Big City until they all eventually reach outer space! Oswald and Weenie finally rescue Catrina and manage to hitch a ride back to big City on a shooting star.

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Henry is taking a special picture of the gang in front of Big City’s geyser. While waiting around for their picture to be taken they decide to play a ball game but Weenie gets all covered in mud! Oswald tries to give Weenie a bath, but she doesn’t want to take one. After chasing her around Big City and getting himself and his friend all wet in the process, Oswald finally manages to get Weenie clean again and everyone has their picture taken.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob and the team are completing work on a brand new fitness trail in the sports stadium park. They must finish before the afternoon’s Spring City Fun Run - a steeplechase across the fitness trail obstacle course, organised by Scoop’s idol Skye Sampson, a fitness guru and world champion record-breaking athlete. When Scoop is told that only humans will be competing, he sets up his own competition: the Muscle Machine Games! With events including “Weightlifting” (with a pallet of wooden beams) and “Discuss Throw” (with an old tyre) Lofty and Muck both break new records...

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Mayor Madison has arranged for Ballroom Blitz, TV dance sensation, to come on tour to Spring City. When star dancer, Sylvain de Souza, threatens to cancel the show unless he gets a sprung dance floor, Maria enlists Bob to save the day, in return for a show tango with her hero. Dance fever sweeps Team Bob and the Spring City Rockets but Lofty despairs of ever being able to dance as well as the others. Just as he finds his dancing mojo, Lofty accidentally wrecks part of the sprung dance floor. Sylvain recognizes a kindred spirit in Lofty and urges him to follow his dreams, no matter how unlikely they may seem.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
