programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The snow in the meadow is so deep that Little Nutbrown Hare has to stay under the Old Oak tree. Wondering what he is going to do all day in deep snow and with no one to play with, his imagination soon takes over as he creates new kinds of fun. By the time his friends reach him, Little Nutbrown Hare can’t believe how the time has flown!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: On a cold but sunny morning in the middle of Winter, Little Nutbrown Hare discovers his friends ice-skating on the frozen pond. He decides to give it a try but slips, slops and slides all over the ice. Will he persevere for long enough to be able to perfect his own unique style, or will he be put off by the natural skill of his friends?

programme.title: Learning Time With Timmy
programme.desc: The class is having a picnic and everyone is happy. Especially Paxton! Learn about healthy snacks with Otus, Stripey and Yabba.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: When Huckle, Lowly and Sally find a lost bag, they use the eyeglass case, atomizer, map, and a red scarf inside it to determine that the owner is a famous international opera star who’s come to Busytown to perform for the first time./Cyclists getting flat tires somewhere in Busytown lead Huckle and the gang on a mystery.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world, a poorly Messy is sitting in the living room feeling very sorry for himself. “Aaachooo!” he sneezes and he wipes his nose with a tissue. “Don’t like colds” he groans “but I love green socks” and guzzles down the nearest green sock he can find. Hmmm Messy looks confused and not satisfied at all. “Why does food taste different when I have a cold?” He transports himself to Okido to find out.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world, a single floating red balloon has caught Messy’s curiosity in the garden. Messy takes a gigantic leap into the air to catch the balloon as it floats past him but it’s no use! Other blue balloons bob on the ground but they don’t look as fun and floaty at all. “Aww”, says Messy, “I really wanted that red balloon! Why do some balloons float but others don’t?” He glances disappointedly at the red balloon as it continues to float further out of his reach. He transports himself to Okido to find out.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: Day Of The Diesels Pe
programme.desc: The Steamies and the Diesels face off in this action-packed movie adventure! When a fire breaks out on the Island of Sodor, two new firefighting engines Flynn and Belle join Thomas and Percy to save the day!

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: At the girls campout, Sour launches into a whopper of a yarn about the adventures she and Sweet had in the "Berry Deep Dark Forest." She tries to get Sweet to participate in spinning the tale, but Sours over-the-top performance leaves Sweet behind. Toward the end, Sour graciously changes the story to pull Sweet into it, giving Sweet the opportunity to toss in an ad lib that makes a nice topper to Sours story. Sweet is thrilled when everyone applauds her, even Sour, who is impressed by her contribution and proud of her sister.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: When Harry is disappointed that none of his wishes come true in the real world, the dinosaurs take him to visit the wishing well.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry, Charlie, and the dinosaurs are playing at being pirates.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: The Junior Rangers bring a young Rothschild’s giraffe to the savannah to find it a good home. However, the expedition comes to a standstill when the Junior Rangers’ jeep gets bogged in mud.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Thomas misses his best friend Percy while working on the Chinese railway.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: A new tunnel-boring machine called Darcy arrives on Sodor. She has come to work on the new road being built by Miss Jenny’s Construction Crew and is eager to impress her new friends. She makes several mistakes, and worries she doesn’t fit in with the other engines. Nia encourages Darcy to be herself and she soon makes up for her mistakes when everyone sees what she can really do!

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Grisu is entrusted with what seems to be an easy mission. It consists in moving a beehive in a field of honey flowers. But things get complicated when an accident occurs, and the beehive gets lost. Moreover, Grisu has to deal with Fume who has a sore throat and cannot spit fire. Grisu will finally succeed in getting the bee queen (and the other bees) into the beehive thanks to Miss Gertruds perfume. And Fume will be cured thanks to the honey!

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Natureza is on the ice cap conducting a polar bear study. She still has one last bear to tag but its too fast. So she needs a snowmobile pilot to help her approach and tag the beast. Its a perfect mission for Grisu who is no snowmobile pilot, but can adapt to anything and is impervious to cold! As he lands on the polar cap, Grisu unwittingly wakes up the napping bear and is chased after by it. He gets out of his bind thanks to Natureza. As theyre getting ready to tag the bear, Grisu, unwittingly again, burns the snowmobile engine. The mission seems compromised, but a firefighter never gives up! Resourceful Grisu uses his wind-filled parachute to pull the snowmobile and thanks to him, Natureza ends up tagging the bear.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare befriends a little yellow fluffy creature by the river, and it follows him everywhere, quacking and copying his every move. It’s too little to speak and doesn’t look like any creature Little Nutbrown Hare or his friends have seen before. How will he return it to its parents if he doesn’t know what kind of creature it is?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: When Little Nutbrown Hare sees Blue Bird building a nest, he thinks it looks like fun, so he and Little Field Mouse build one themselves. But its a bit too scratchy and tickly for them to get comfortable in. They give it to their friends to try out, but they also find it not quite right. Will anybody find their nest cozy and useful?

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: All of the forest dwellers are on high alert because of animminent threat of flooding. Edmund and Margaret give each of the children a small basket so they can take the essentials with them. For Scoutbadger, Rosie and Berry, the choice is quite simple, but for Woodsy, very attached to all his objects, its a real ordeal... How will he make up his mind when time is running out?

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Team Bob are preparing to dig the foundations for a skyscraper in Spring City’s new business zone and are under pressure from Mayor Madison to get started. She keeps interrupting their work on Bob’s smart-phone. Scoop and Muck set a challenge to see which of them can dig/clear the earth quickest. Interrupted again, Bob calls a halt but the machines get carried away and keep digging. Scoop goes too deep and hits into something hard underground. Bob calls Anish Bose, the archaeologist, who announces the discovery of Roman ruins. The build will have to halt while they excavate the site. Scoop is filled with remorse and horrified to learn that Romans didn’t have machines like him. An interested crowd starts to gather as Anish discovers more artefacts. Mr Bentley arrives for a progress report but rather than being angry at the lack of progress he is excited by the historic discovery.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: It’s Christmas time. Bob and the team are building the Spring City Christmas display in the city centre’s plaza. Lofty loves everything Christmas and decorates the yard in snowflakes. Then he sees that Bob’s home doesn’t have any decorations, so he decides to give him the perfect present. Lofty arrives on site, determined to give Bob his Christmas present but when asked to help hang the lights, he puts the present down by the giant display tree. Lofty finishes his work and again tries to give Bob his present but now it’s lost somewhere in the display.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Something knocks Sgt. Murphy’s hat off his head, chops the tops of Baker Humperdink’s baguettes, and sheers a path through a flower bed. Although no one saw anything, they all heard it make the same whoop whoop whoop sound. Putting the clues together, Huckle, Sally and Lowly figure out that it was Vanderbuilt’s new, out of control, boomerang./The mysterious disappearance of Mayor Fox leaves Huckle and the gang on an important search.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Zari was backpacking through the forest where she discovers a bunch of discarded leaves and branches on the floor due to the aftermath of the storm. As she investigate further, the wind blows a paper cup near her. Zari was perplexed as she mistaken the insect with an actual leaf, causing her to call in the Rangers. Back at the headquarters, Leo is searching for Hero and Katie as theyre playing hide And seek. As Leo is struggling to find Katie, he receives a call from Zari, who asks for help with the strange animal. Leo and Katie travels with PlatypusOne to reach Zari. As they arrived, Zari tells them to be careful because the leaves on the ground could be a Malayan Leaf insect too. After carefully going investigate and not finding any, the wind manage to blow the Malayan Leaf insect out of Katies hand. Leo chases it down with his jetpack, manage to safe the animal from harm. The gang then tries to find a proper place for the insect. They then stumble a new location, where a mouse-deer is nearby. Leo put the insect on a high branch, when suddenly they got greeted by Ranger Rocky. He then calls for Ranger Joey for more information on the Malayan Leaf Insect, where she fully explains its habitat and predators that may appear. She advices them that the mouse-deer might mistake the insect as an actual leaf and would eat it, where Leo take the advice and put the insect somewhere higher on the trees. The Rangers went home where Leo put the Malayan Leaf insect photo on the wall. He then figured to look for Katie and hero to continue their game earlier, but Katie and Hero was already inside the treehouse, indifferent to Leos game. Ranger Rocky finally thanks them for a great job on the computer screen.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: As Farah is drawing poop on her handbook in the national park, she hears a loud growl nearby and leaps onto her dirtbike to seek the source. She sees a lioness and her cub stuck inside a man-made well, clumsily failing to get out. She immediately calls the Rangers for help. Back in the garden, Leo And Katie were playing frisbee. Katie tries to do throw it just like Leo does it but she fails, upsetting her. As Leo instructs Katie on how to do it, he receives the call from Farah. Farah tells them about the trapped animals, causing the duo to learn more about the lion back in the treehouse. Farah then informs them of more lions coming over, where Leo tells her to get to safety first. As the Rangers arrive and land PlatypusOne from afar, Leo uses his binoculars and sees the 2 female lions still roaming around the well. They see Farah hides on top of a nearby hill and meet her there. As they were discussing on how to help the lioness, Katie points out a fallen log nearby that can be used. Farah misunderstood and rush onto her bike to cause a distraction for the 2 lioness around the well, but Ranger Rocky appears and stops her. Ranger Rocky then ask more information on the Asiatic Lion from Ranger Joey. Ranger Joey advices them about the Asiatic Lions hunting behavior, giving the group an idea to pretend as a Sambar Deer to distract the animal there.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Simon is Lou’s best friend, until one day when he realizes that Ferdinand is also Lou’s best friend. Simon is jealous but as soon as Ferdinand realizes that Lou has lice, he no longer wants to play with her. Simon on the other hand, couldn’t care less about lice! That’s what being a best friend is all about! And he invents a game so that everyone will want to play with Lou. And sure enough, at the end, she gives Simon a big kiss: YIPPEE!!!!

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry becomes sad because he can not climb on the rainbow but Dolly makes him happy with an exceptionally creative present.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry the snailboy and Dolly the ladybird are the best friends ever. They’re having many pretty adventures in 3X13 short tales, while they make new friends and get knowledges about the world around them.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly 01 Mepe
programme.desc: The characters in the Berry and Dolly stories are a bunch of tiny bugs and beetles who live alongside one another in the forest. All the characters’ houses, belongings and clothes perfectly match their individual appearance.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: It turns out whether there are witches or not, and that it is not nice to frighten others.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry and Dolly goes to the kindergarten and the day passes fast with lot of interesting plays.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and his friends put on a show in the park. After Coco’s dance, Pando’s song and Sula’s acrobatics display everyone is excited to see Bing’s finale. When he gets up on the stage Bing is overcome with stage fright so his friends, and rainbow fairy mice, come to the rescue.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing tries to show Sula she doesnt need to wear earmuffs to watch the fireworks but when a loud bang sends Bing flying, he doesnt think they are such a bad idea!

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing is sad when his new orange balloon pops so Flop helps him make a Bye Bye Box, a memory box for broken toys too special to throw away.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Pando play on the swings together but when Pando takes longer than his turn, Bing gets angry and runs infront of the swings and gets bumped.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: A new kind of biscuit has been delivered to the village shop and Molly would dearly love to know how they taste. Under Tildas alarmed gaze, she climbs up the counter on which the biscuit tin is standing, climbs inside – and when a gust of wind blows the lid shut, cant get out again. Horrified, Tilda rushes off to get help from Rupert.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Molly stands trembling at Tildas door: last night she heard noises in the village shop and then found an empty tin can. Its bound to have been a hungry ghost making trouble! That night, Tilda, Rupert, Molly and Edna lie in wait in the village shop to catch the ghost red-handed.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: A tiring gardening session make the friends of Wild Rose Lane dream of going away on holiday. But none of them wants to be all alone in far-off places. So Tilda suggests that they simply swap homes. No sooner said than done! Tilda moves in to Ednas, Molly to Ruperts, Robin to Tildas, the squirrels to Mollys and Rupert to Robins.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare watches as Blue Bird’s eggs hatch into three happy, chirpy baby birds. Fascinated and charmed by these youngsters, he visits them every day and even helps teach them to sing, play and fly. But how will he feel when Summer is on its way and they are ready to fly the nest and make homes of their own?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: It’s Spring blossom season and the pretty pink blossoms that come floating down the stream remind Big Nutbrown Hare of a magnificent cherry tree from his youth. He sets off cross- country to find it, with Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse, but the journey is longer and harder than he remembered. Will the blossoms floating downstream give them a clue as to a shorter way home?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and his friends go on a hunt for treasure in the meadow and collect all kinds of unique gems like flowers, feathers, apples and egg-shells. But there’s a hole in Little Nutbrown Hare’s leaf-bag and he loses the precious collection along the way. Luckily, Big Nutbrown Hare is not far behind to collect the lost treasure as well as follow its trail to find his son.

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: Badge Quest is a series in which Wilson, Brewster and Koko attempt to earn a badge. Almost every character from the first season is featured in these episodes.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: In this rainforest adventure, Peyo, while collecting colorful flowers, encounters a tiny, vibrant Poison Dart Frog. Pico goes into protective mode, preventing Peyo from getting too close to the potentially dangerous frog. He calls Leo and Katie, who checks on the computer and learns about Poison Dart Frogs, emphasizing their toxic nature. The frog suddenly jumps into Peyo’s satchel which calls for the team to travel to the rainforest to address the situation. As they arrive, Leo manages to get the frog out of the satchel with his grabber but the frog ends up jumping around which causes a commotion with everyone being scared to get too close. Suddenly, Ranger Rocky shows up and the frog is nowhere to be found! On high alert, they look around for the frog which ends up being on Ranger Rocky’s hat which he gently places on the ground and Peyo retrieves his satchel safely. However, the frog then jumps onto Hero’s backpack and gets flung onto a floating leaf in a river, prompting a rescue mission as they learnt that the frog is not a good swimmer. Using quick thinking and Peyo’s satchel, the Junior Rangers save the frog and find a suitable spot for it to rest by the river. Back in the Treehouse, Leo hangs a photo of the frog while Katie commends Hero’s smelling skills and deems them better than Leo’s.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: In the deserts of Africa, Jane and Zumi take a break from patrolling. While Jane dozes off, Zumi detects a disturbance - a baby hyena in distress. Despite trying to wake Jane, Zumi decides to investigate alone, following the baby hyena as it walks aimlessly, further away. In the garden, Leo, Katie, and Hero are trying to make each other laugh and whoever laughs first, will have to mow the lawn. Katie ends up losing for laughing at her own joke but is saved from mowing with a call from Jane. Alarmed by Zumi missing, they travel to Africa to help Jane. Zumis disappearance prompts a search using a sound detector and Katie’s tablet to pick up sounds from far away and after hearing from different animals, they finally capture the laugh of the baby hyena! They head towards the sound and stumble upon Ranger Rocky who startled them with a lion’s roar. After learning about hyenas from Ranger Joey, Ranger Joey mentions a lion finishing its meal and Katie suggests that the hyenas might show up for its leftovers. Hence, the rangers head towards the leftovers and as predicted, a clan of hyenas show up and the baby hyena immediately runs towards them, ending in a loving embrace with its mother. Back at the treehouse, Leo calls it mission accomplished and teases Katie who is disgruntled, mowing the lawn.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi and Nina are excited to be looking after a guest - a friend’s "unique" rooster by the name of Rigoletto. They ask Fred what makes it so unique but he’s not sure; all he knows is that they need to take good care of it. However, despite being housed in its very own enclosure, Rigoletto escapes and goes missing!! Huh! Maybe the animal’s "uniqueness" will allow the kids to track it down…?

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Ciboulette the cat has stolen Fanni’s plush toy, making the little girl extremely sad. T’choupi and Nina are determined to get the toy back but the cat refuses to comply! After several vain attempts at approaching Ciboulette, the two friends receive unexpected assistance… from the chickens!.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Today is "picnic in the forest day!" And T’choupi and his friends are going to be riding there on their bicycles. Yay, how exciting!... Except, for some reason, Nina doesn’t seem too enthusiastic about it… That’s strange – what could possibly be the matter?: she loves going to the forest and is always up for adventure! She agrees to go in the end, albeit reluctantly. But before long, T’choupi discovers her "shameful secret…"

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: The whole class is training in the woods for the next school Olympiads. Shelley asks her pupils to divide themselves into two groups of four athletes. But everyone is quickly at odds. There are more boys than girls… Names are pulled from a hat at random and Charley finds himself the only boy in a group of girls. Charley sighs.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Tonight there is a children show for the parents. Julia planned a scooter act with Sam. But Sam doesnt dare to tell her he is very bad on those wheels. How long can he avoid to tell her the truth?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: To help his little brother Ben feel less frustrated by his young age, Sam decided to help him. Together with Julia, they try to come up with a good scheme to make him feel like a hero.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam and Julia have decided to play doctors to help their friends stuffed animals and heal dolls hurts. Dr. Julia and Sam, her nurse, pay visits to some of them in the Mouse Mansion.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Toby is always nervous when he has to go through Knapford Junction with the big gantry signal over the track. One day Toby waits nervously for his signal to change, but it stays on red. He waits and waits, holding up other engines, but the signal doesn’t change. The Fat Controller is very cross until everybody finally realises the signal is broken.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Oliver is always telling his brake van Toad about his adventures and Toad longs to have an adventure of his own. So when the chance comes to work with James, Toad is very excited. But James doesn’t like pulling trucks and goes too fast and then, when a coupling snaps, Toad gets a bigger adventure than he bargained for.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Billy is put in charge of Clementine, Leo and Caillou for five minutesat the beach. How much adventure could they get into? Well, thanks to asurf-obsessed Caillou, a lost hair clip, and a rogue seagul... Quite alot!

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou and his family head out on Grandpas boat for theafternoon, but in Caillous mind theyre crossing treacherous seasin pursuit of pirate treasure!

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: A mysterious giant circle appears in the middle of a corn field. Although Pig Will and Pig Won’t are convinced it’s the landing site of an alien flying saucer, Huckle puts the clues together and ultimately goes up in a hot air balloon to reveal the flattened area is actually Vincent Van Goat’s latest artistic endeavor./When flying potatoes are dropping from the sky in Busytown, Huckle and gang are determined to find out why.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Monkey is sitting and looking up at the full moon when he hears a howl makes him jump into Parrots hammock! Mole explains that the howl is a way for the wolf to communicate with other members of its pack.Just then we hear a different howl which sounds very near. It is coming from a wolf cub. Monkey decides to bring the cub back to its pack in the tundra.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: A "pesky" mole causes trouble for Moose when the mole decides that Moose’s Wild Man Golf course is the perfect place to build a few molehills. Meanwhile the firefighters learn the Breathing Apparatus Boogie!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Its the Annual Pontypandy Bread Baking Competition and Hannah is determined to win by baking bread on an open fire, but her competitive streak ends up causing a wildfire. Meanwhile Miss Pawdry sabotages Elvis’s cleaning efforts.

programme.title: Franklin And Friends
programme.desc: Franklin and his friends embark on an exciting school project to write the songs for an upcoming musical pageant about the four seasons, with the help of the musical Beavers. But when every idea Franklin and Snail get for their spring song seems to be already taken by one of the other groups, they struggle with the assignment. It is only through true perseverance do they finally hit upon their very own unique idea – a spring song that celebrates all the seasons!

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Grandpa Fox is teaching Rosie and Woodsy how to find their way in the forest. The lesson becomes more difficult when Grandpa disappears. In order to find the way back to the burrow, Rosie and Woodsy will have to put into practice what they have learned and, above all, stop quarrelling.

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: With just a few strokes of his pencil, Doodleboo always manages to do a funny drawing that comes to life as soon as it has been coloured.

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Who is the true king of hide and seek? Doodleboo explains how to draw a Chameleon.

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: What allows you to go play in the clouds? Doodleboo explains how to draw an hot air balloon

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Hatty shows Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave how to take perfect photographs of Speedy Sheep, Sneezy Sheep and Little Lamb for their aunt’s photo album. But there’s so much to remember to get that perfect shot: make sure your subject is happy and smiling, frame your picture with the subject in the centre, don’t cover the lens and hold your camera steady to avoid getting blurry images!

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Hatty, Tweet and Dave help Ruff-Ruff make up a story about pirates! Captain Ruff-Ruff, Pirate Dave and Princess Pirate Tweet go in search of treasure on Desert Island, singing a pirate song as they go. Ruff-Ruff want to dig for buried treasure, but his pirate crew find a treasure chest, filled with all their favourite things, aboard a real pirate ship! The pirates agree to share the treasure and Hatty records Ruff-Ruff’s story in a special storybook.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Summer is at its hottest and Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse want to run and play but the sun is just too hot and strong. That’s until Little Grey Squirrel gives them both a wonderful present, big leafy parasols. When he later changes his mind and takes Little Nutbrown Hare’s parasol back, the little hare is naturally disappointed. Can the friends find a way for all of them to be happy?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: You Summer in the meadow is a great time to find tasty snacks to eat. Big Nutbrown Hare seems to know all the best tricks and hiding spots for the yummy treats and Little Nutbrown Hare can’t help but wish he was as big and smart as his father. However, he soon finds out that there are some things a little Nutbrown Hare can teach a Big Nutbrown Hare.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: On Summer’s hottest night Little Nutbrown Hare finds it hard to sleep. When a swim in the river isn’t enough to cool him down, Little Nutbrown Hare and his friends ask Little White Owl to tell them a really cold and sleepy bedtime story. Will she come up with a story that can make them feel cool and finally get Little Nutbrown Hare off to sleep?

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Sula and Amma have come to Bings house for lunch but there are no carrots so Flop pops to the shop to get some. Bing stays behind but its not long before he starts to miss Flop. Missing Flop... its a Bing thing!

programme.title: Bing Bunny

programme.desc: Coco is staying at Bings house for her first sleepover but things dont go so well when they find out their different bedtime routines.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula have a penny each for the Surprise Machine in Padget’s shop. Sula gets the silver rhino she wanted so Bing is convinced he will get the toy he wants too. programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing wants to get dizzy on the roundybout so Pando pushes him. Its not long before Bing realises that some dizzy is fun but too much dizzy is not fun at all.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry, Dolly, Stanley, Balthazar, Flutter and Bubble are hiking in the forest on a beautiful autumn day. Suddenly they recognized that someone is crying in the bush. They found a mushroom without his hat. The friends immediately start to help him.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: One spring day, Frank longhorn beetle visits his friend, Stanley. Frank suggests to organize a football match. Everyone wants to play football, the two teams get together quickly. The girls cheer on the sidelines. The game is about to start.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: The kids find some numbered papers blowing around the park. After investigating several possibilities of where they could be from, they finally figure out they were once fastened to trees in the park as part of a self-guided tour to celebrate Arbor Day. / When all the milk in Huckle’s Dad’s store turns out to be sour, Huckle, Sally and Lowly set out to find out why.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Parrot is couching Monkey, after some jumping jacks Parrots asks him to kick a punching bag. Monkey tries but keeps falling out of balance; each time he kicks he falls back… Mole appears and tells them of the donkeys famous precise kick. Monkey is enthused to learn his technique and off they go to the farm.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Norman practices his magic act for the talent show, but it turns out that his assistant Mandy is better at magic than he is. But when he tries to make her disappear, he accidentally causes a fire. Meanwhile, Radar turns out to be quite the diva…

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Its time for the finale of the Pontypandy Festival - the Big Pontypandy Talent Show! But when Elvis knocks a drink over the drone control panel, the drones crash land, causing fires in the fields all around the show area.

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: Mouse wants Kipper to push her along on a roller skate. He’s got a better idea. Why don’t they play Hide and Seek? She doesn’t know what it is so Kipper explains that she covers her eyes and counts to ten while someone hides. Mouse hides first but when it’s her turn to count she confesses to Kipper that she can’t count past five. Kipper says he’ll teach her and he does his best but in the end it’s easier to count to five TWICE. But by the end of the game Mouse counts all the way to ten – AND finds Kipper.

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: Tiger decides to invite everyone to a fancy dress party. Kipper, Pig and Jake dont know what Tigers going to be dressed as - but the invitation says no one is to come as a pirate!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Tchoupi and Nina come across a waddling hedgehog while they’re playing in the vegetable garden. When their moms explain how beneficial these cute little creatures are to gardens, the two friends decide to do everything they can to make the hedgehog feel at home among the vegetables… Until the little animal… disappears!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: When T’choupi comes down for breakfast this particular morning, he finds the kitchen in a total mess! Nina comes and tells him that the vegetable garden has also been turned upside down! Who could possibly have done this?... At first, they suspect Ciboulette the cat… until they find out that the culprit is a super cute newcomer.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam and Julia unintentionally damaged Ellas favorite doll. How can they repair it and put it back at her place without Ella realizing? It seems they have to develop a lot of skills to do so.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Ella never had the golden ball that the baker hides every year in a cheese puff and that is supposed to bring luck. Ella thinks it should be her turn. Except that Julia has never had it either...

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Molly is excited for her friend Mings visit and to show her favourite spot. However, Ming keeps getting distracted. Molly eventually goes alone, but Ming finds her, and the picnic can finally begin.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: Turbulent thinks that Toto is really lucky: he does not have to take a bath every day. The next morning the little boy decides to sleep in Totos basket and walk on all fours. Girl and Poet quickly follow him along! But Mom has had enough and decides to teach them a lesson: how about dog food for dinner, a basket instead of a bed and... No hugs? The Triplets can only admit that it is definitely better to be kids!

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: The Triplets would love to have their very own race tracks to play with their toy cars, but Mom disagrees « You already have too many toys! ». However Kiko may have found a solution! How about trying to hypnotize Mom? The Triplets try to learn how to use a hypnotic spiral but the results are unfortunately not that promising. Luckily, Grandpa is going to play along and, who knows, maybe he’ll grant them their wish!

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: The parents leave for an adventure and the children decide to have some big adventures too. For Scoutbadger and Rosie this means going far from the burrow while for Woodsy it means building some wings so that he can fly. But perhaps these big dreams are just a little too big ?

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou is at a pottery studio with Mommy and he wants tomake his dad the best present ever for Fathers Day. Except pottery isa lot harder than it seems! Wow. After a big mess, he learns that itsbetter to go slow at first, that practice makes perfect, and that,actually, things dont have to be perfect to be great.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: It’s Leo’s birthday, and Caillou is having his very first Sleepover! Heattends the sleepover with Leo’s cousin, who is a wheelchair user.Pretty soon after arriving, Caillou accidentally spills his juice onthe carpet. He panics, and rather than admitting the mistake to Leo’smommy, he covers up the stain with Leo’s wrapped up gifts.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: A storm is approaching and Skiff and Joe, the Lighthouse Keeper, patrol Arlesburgh, helping everyone to prepare for it. Duck and Oliver don’t think a ‘tiny little railboat’ should be out in a storm and it seems they are right when Skiff’s anchor rope snaps and his sail unfurls. Skiff is terrified as he gets blown down the track and right into a tree that lightning has brought down across the branchline. When Skiff realises that both Oliver and Duck are heading towards the tree he manages to raise his sail to warn them and avert a serious accident.

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: With guidance from the ever-wise Hanzo, Tai must learn how to remain focused, calm, and balanced.

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: The Trainees are on a mission to play top-secret spy games in Chuggington but their sleuthing missions turn into wild shenanigans.

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: The whole class is training in the woods for the next school Olympiads. Shelley asks her pupils to divide themselves into two groups of four athletes. But everyone is quickly at odds. There are more boys than girls… Names are pulled from a hat at random and Charley finds himself the only boy in a group of girls. Charley sighs.

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave become The Special Delivery Crew, delivering parcels to their animal friends. They discover the importance of reading the pictorial labels correctly, to work out whom each parcel is for and where they live.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Luce has brought one of T’choupi’s favorite games: a Seek And Find game based on Nature! Mom comes along and suggests they go for a walk in the forest. The kids love the idea… as long as we can bring the game with! Mom agrees. But on the way, Luce drops the game, losing some of the pieces. She doesn’t say anything to the others, but when the time comes to start playing, the missing pieces make it impossible to continue past a certain point! Oh nooo!! So Mom suggests they play Seek And Find for real, in the forest! The first one to find a chestnut, a hedgehog or a frog…!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Kai is operating his drone to film for his film of the underwater environment. He recorded some fish but none are interesting to him. Then he encounters a starfish that piques his interest and think its the great subject for his film. Back in the garden, Katie are sketching Leo on her notepad as Leo poses. He moves as a fly keeps bugging him, making Katie irritated. Leo then receives a call from Kai who explain of the animal he discover. After learning more about it in the treehouse, the Junior Rangers agree to meetup with Kai in the ocean. Once they arrive, Kai instruct Leo And Katie to act around the starfish but theyre acting was bad. Kai films the starfish but it keeps doing nothing so he fall asleep while Leo and Katie are playing with Hero who is playing with a seashell. As Kai wakes up, they get greeted by Ranger Rocky. The Junior Rangers explain the situations causing him to call for Ranger Joey for more information on the animal. After learning useful tips, they found that the starfish had disappeared and later got carried away in a plastic bag stuck in by a sea turtle. Ranger Rocky manages to distract the sea turtle and Leo grab the plastic with his grabber. The starfish falls over and slowly fall over and reunite with other starfish. The day are saved and the Junior Rangers goes home. Back in the garden, Leo sees the sketch that Katie finished.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: One night, Berry and Dolly saw a shiny thing falling from the sky. Fearfully, they head to the depths of the forest to find out what the strange light might be. They found a star-shaped house and a girl.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: One day Berry and Flutter played a board game. The first round was won by Berry, and the second one was won by him as well. In the third round, Flutter finished first. Berry got very angry. They played another round, but Flutter won again. Berry couldn’t help but made a scene.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: Stanley and Balthazar ruin Flutters playing cards, but seeing the butterfly girls sadness, they ask Dollys help to make a brand new card deck.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: Leapy the grasshopper makes fun of Katie the yellow ladybird, because she blows bigger bubbles than her. Later, regretting her actions, Leapy has to find a way to apologize to Katie.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: Dolly accidentally knocks over a glass of water on Berrys painting. The colors on Berrys painting get faint and watery. Berry gets mad at Dolly for ruining his painting. Later Berrys friends admire the little snails unique style of painting, so he insists that it was his idea to make the painting like this. But then Dolly arrives and sheds light to Berrys lies.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: At Ammas crèche a butterfly lands on Sulas painting. Bing tries to help it go outside but accidentally squishes it. Flop and Amma help the sad children say goodbye.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The playful rabbit wants to draw a big picture, so Flop finds him some chalk to create a stripy, spotty, zig-zag dinosaur on the pavement

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula find a potato in Amma’s vegetable patch with a comical ‘face’, so they take it under their wing, naming it “Nosey”. The two children look after Nosey and show him around the crèche but unfortunately Nosey goes down the slide too quickly and his ‘nose’ falls off. Amma shows them how to plant both bits of potato so that they can grow new potatoes.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing discovers a hole in his favourite yellow wellies but he doesnt want to throw them away in the stinky dustbin.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop hear the familiar jingle of Gillys ice cream van and race across the park to find her. After a long run Bing finally gets his ice cream but as he waves goodbye to Gilly he tips the ice cream out of the cone.

programme.title: Bing Bunny - Shorts and characters
programme.desc: Get to know our little pets better through charming stories featuring the characters from the popular Bing series.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Simon and Lou are making a snowman in the yard when they get hit by a load of snowballs, but they cant see whos throwing them. Can they find out who the strange snowballers are?

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: When Rosie, Scoutbadger and Woodsy are busy with their friends, Berry realises that she does not have one of her own. So, when she finds a twisted little branch that looks a bit like an animal’s face, she calls it Cherry, says that it is her friend and brings it in to be part of the family. However, Berry’s artificial friend starts to take up a little too much room.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The snow in the meadow is so deep that Little Nutbrown Hare has to stay under the Old Oak tree. Wondering what he is going to do all day in deep snow and with no one to play with, his imagination soon takes over as he creates new kinds of fun. By the time his friends reach him, Little Nutbrown Hare can’t believe how the time has flown!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: On a cold but sunny morning in the middle of Winter, Little Nutbrown Hare discovers his friends ice-skating on the frozen pond. He decides to give it a try but slips, slops and slides all over the ice. Will he persevere for long enough to be able to perfect his own unique style, or will he be put off by the natural skill of his friends?

programme.title: Boribon
programme.desc: Home sometimes gets crowded, especially when theres a teddy-bear battle going on. There isnt enough space left for Boribons blue teddy bears. Annalee eventually finds a solution to the problem.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam and Julia discover in their secret hideout an old comforter that probably belonged once to a child from the Mouse Mansion. Who, among the inhabitants, loose this cuddly toy in his childhood?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Uncle Ramstout stored boxes in Sam and Julias secret lair. To avoid being invaded and lose their privacy, they must find a way to clear out his workshop in order to make room for those boxes.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: 24 days seem like a very long wait until Christmas. But the Triplets may have an idea to speed up time. What if they ate all the chocolates from their Christmas calendar at once? Of course, Mom is not happy and warns them: they had better be good, because Santa is watching and doesn’t bring gifts to kids who do not behave! Oh no, they only have three weeks to make up for a whole year of silly things!

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: Mom is having a dinner party at home tonight and she is running all over the place to finish cleaning the house in time. When she goes out to do a round-trip to the bakery, the Triplets decide to give her a hand. But nothing goes as planned: the vacuum cleaner brakes, the couch is stained and the corridor is full of soap. Be careful Mom, the floor is very very slippery!

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: The Chuggineers are busy constructing a new station. Brewster gets under everybody’s wheels until Zack lets him take the welding wagon away to practice with. Down an old disused line, Brewster finds lots of old junk to weld together. Koko persuades him to go exploring along an overgrown track. They cross a dried out streambed and the rusty track collapses behind them, leaving them stranded. They both need to get back -­‐ Brewster has to return Zack’s welder wagon and Koko has a passenger run. Suddenly Brewster realizes that he might be able to mend the track by welding it.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Norman practices his magic act for the talent show, but it turns out that his assistant Mandy is better at magic than he is. But when he tries to make her disappear, he accidentally causes a fire. Meanwhile, Radar turns out to be quite the diva…

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Its time for the finale of the Pontypandy Festival - the Big Pontypandy Talent Show! But when Elvis knocks a drink over the drone control panel, the drones crash land, causing fires in the fields all around the show area.

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: Kipper, Tiger and Jake are having a day on the river. It takes ages to do up their lifejackets and Tiger loses his cap. Jake rows them in a circle and Tiger does a special knot to tie the boat up when they stop for lunch but it comes undone and the boat drifts away. By the end of the day they are glad to be back on dry land.

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: Kipper is waiting for Pig and Arnold at the duck pond when a small friendly robot clanks out of the water. At Kipper’s house it tries a piece of bread, a milk shake and some chocolate cookies but when Kipper introduces Hippo, to his horror, the robot eats him too! Happily Kipper and Hippo are reunited at the duck pond.

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D)
programme.desc: Caillou is frustrated when he can’t score a basket in his new basketball hoop. After pretending he’s in charge of a space mission, guiding a shuttle pilot (Mommy) into a moon crater, Caillou learns to slow down and take a breath. This helps him finally score a basket!

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D)
programme.desc: When Caillou cant get the steps right to a block party line dance, he worries he’ll ruin the dance for everyone. But Grandmas story about square dancing for a famous square dance caller (Caillou) helps Caillou overcome his anxiety and dance the night away.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: When Thomas and Diesel are sent to collect trucks from the Ffarquhar Quarry, they argue about who should be the back engine. But then Diesel suggests he take the trucks with Mavis and leave Thomas to look after the quarry until they get back. When they don’t come back, Thomas gets fed up and decides to take another load of troublesome trucks on his own and then there is trouble!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Jayden is about to take a bite of his peanut butter sandwich before things take an unexpected turn when a crafty raccoon snatches his comms device. Simultaneously, Leo and Katie engage in a decluttering activity in the garden, pondering which possessions to keep or give away. They receive a call from Jayden but instead of seeing Jayden on the screen, it’s the raccoon on the run! Confused, this prompts the Junior Rangers swift response. They arrive and meet with a tired and lost Jayden who shows them the direction the raccoon went. This leads them near a road where the raccoon runs in the middle of it, which raises the rangers’ concerns about relocating the raccoon. They meet up with Ranger Rocky who calls Ranger Joey to provide insights into raccoon behavior and habits. Jaydens ingenious use of a peanut butter and jelly sandwich to bait the raccoon into giving back the comms device works but Ranger Rocky intervenes and reminds them not to feed wildlife but the raccoon scurries off. The day concludes with a successful mission and Leo, Katie and Hero continue with sorting their stuff and Hero lets go of his unused toy.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Farah, navigating the scorching Thar Desert, finds Hardwickes Spiny-Tailed Lizards seemingly braving the intense heat. Concerned for their well-being, she contacts Leo and Katie who are in the garden about to commence in a water gun chase but are interrupted when Hero steals the water gun. Upon consulting the computer, they learn that the lizards need sunlight to regulate their body temperature. During the call, a falcon appears and scares the lizards back into their burrows! Leo, Katie and Hero fly to the desert to help the lizards find a way to stay in the sun without being harmed by the falcon. Attempting to aid them, they construct a tent, only for it to crash to their disappointment. They meet with Ranger Rocky who seeks advice from Ranger Joey, they discover the importance of sunlight for these cold-blooded creatures. A lizard approaches the rangers, trusting them enough to be around them when suddenly the falcon swoops in towards it! Hero intervenes to protect the lizard from the falcon and it flies off. With Ranger Rockys assistance, they come up with a new plan to keep the falcon away instead of protecting the lizards. With CDs hung on a tree, it reflects light which scares the falcon. The lizards can now safely bask in the sun, marking the success of the mission. In the Treehouse, a water gun fight ensues between Leo and Katie.

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: Its Chinese Day at school and the children are looking forward to the celebrations.

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: The children of Greendale have been practising for karaoke night.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing finds a frog in the garden, so he and Sula make the frog a house in a bucket.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing wants to play his car park game, but Charlie is visiting and keeps messing it up.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop play shadow tag until it starts raining and Bings shadow is outside getting wet.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Its Bings turn to choose a game at Ammas crèche so he picks Musical Statues but gets upset when he loses because he chose the game.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: When Bings mini racing car and the cereal box collide, they make a big mess. Voo Voo the vacuum cleaner does his job well - maybe even too well!

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Oswald inadvertently makes a date to watch TV with Henry at the same time that hes supposed to go swimming with Daisy. He tries to do both without telling his friends. But as he runs back and forth, he gets more and more mixed up, with hilarious results. Finally, he confesses the truth, and they decide to combine both activities so that they can all be together.

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Oswald goes out to get some cocoa and a newspaper for Henry, who has a bad case of the Arctic Sniffles. On the way, Oswald encounters his friends, who all prescribe different cures – soup, warm clothes, and cough drops. Oswald winds up laden down with the various remedies, and gets caught in a rainstorm as he staggers back home. By then Henry is feeling better, and Oswald is the one with the sniffles!

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: When Mila is appearing on the children’s TV game show, “Whiz-A-Quiz”, the rest of the Spring City Rockets are disappointed that they didn’t get tickets to watch and support her. This gives Mayor Madison the idea for Bob to build an outdoor movie area at the Stadium where everyone can watch the game show together. But when Mayor Madison asks Lofty to help the Spring City Rockets decorate the stadium, he gets carried away and leaves Leo to finish the support frames for the giant screen all by himself. A job that is too big for one person. When the giant screen arrives, the frame isn’t sturdy enough to hold it and the whole structure starts falling apart. Lofty races in and saves the TV screen but the frame, stage and audience seating are broken.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: JJ and Mila are training for a snowboarding stunt show to be performed at the opening of the Winter in Spring Festival - a celebration of winter in Spring City. Bob and the team will be building a triple chairlift to transport passengers to the top of Observatory Hill. But Bob isn’t keen on the cold weather - he’d much prefer to be building sandcastles on the beach! During a work break, Skye offers Bob a snowboarding lesson - and he’s terrible! Meanwhile, Scoop is determined to have a slide down the snowy hill - but Wendy warns him that without snow chains, he’ll have no control. Scoop can’t resist... and ends up sliding all over the slope and crashing into a support beam, causing the chairlift cable to jump off the wheel tracks.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse go on a long trip with Big Nutbrown Hare to find some food he hid away during the warmer months. Little Nutbrown Hare plays with a stick along the way, which turns out to have many uses, one of which is helping them find the food and another is finding their way home again.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare is very proud of a Christmas Tree he has built from pine cones. So proud, that when Little Field Mouse accidentally knocks it over he has trouble forgiving her. When he makes a mistake of his own, Big Nutbrown Hare forgives him immediately, and he understands how important it is to forgive.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Seeing his tracks in the fresh snow inspires Little Nutbrown Hare to create a new game called ‘snow seek’. The friends have a lot of fun creating tracks for Little Nutbrown Hare to follow, but Little Redwood Fox’s tracks completely disappear and so does she. When Big Nutbrown Hare reports that Little Redwood Fox was sighted walking backwards, they work out how she managed to trick them all.

programme.title: Learning Time With Timmy
programme.desc: Timmy likes football. What other things does Timmy like?

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Huckle and the gang race all over Busytown trying to find the lock that fits and old key they found. They search everywhere from the Busytown Museum to Mr Gronkle’s antiques. They come up empty until they remember that an old roll top desk was being delivered to the antique store near where they found the key and had a lock on it. They try the key and it fits. / Chocolate sauce on Lowlys car leaves Huckle and the gang puzzled.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world, Captain Messy is in the garden playing pirates. Equipped with his washing up bowl of bubbles – the seven seas; a rubber duck – the scariest pirate ship; and a big stone – Boulder Island, he plays float or sink. But why do some objects sink to the bottom of the seven seas whilst others stay floating at the top? He journeys to Okido to find out. “Ahoy there me mateys”, shouts Messy, as he lands at Zoe and Felix’s house. Zoe and Felix invite Messy on a boat trip to see the whales of Okido who gather only once every year to sing a beautiful whale song. “A chance to go aboard a pirate ship! That would be brilliant!” says Messy “Let’s Oki-go Arrr!”

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world, Messy is in the living room playing his musical horn. PARP he sounds through a soft play tunnel but to Messy’s surprise he hears the loud PARP repeat back to him. That’s strange? He tilts his head inside “Hello?” To his astonishment he hears the same timid “hello” shout back at him but there’s no-one to be seen! Messy folds his arms and taps his foot “Well if you won’t tell me who you are I’m going to Okido to find out!” and vortexes himself to Okido. Messy arrives in Zoe and Felix’s garden. “Hello” shouts Messy. “Hello” Felix shouts back, but poor Messy can’t see where Felix is hiding and starts to feel uneasy.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: Apple isnt paying attention when Strawberry describes their campout tradition of telling "Tall Tales." So Apple tells her thrilling adventure of a wild road rally she entered, only to surprise the girls by proving the story is actually true.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry decides to imitate his Mum by becoming a newspaper reporter for the day.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: When Harry is disappointed that he cant have what he wants for breakfast he goes to Dino-world.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: The Junior Rangers travel to the rainforest to reunite a Malayan tiger cub with its mother. But when the cub goes missing in some tall grass, the Junior Rangers have to put their heads together to find it.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Emily loves listening to stories of Nias travels - she has been all the way around the world and had some big adventures. It feels like ages since Emily left Sodor to go to the Great Railway Show - and everyones heard that story already. Rebecca can see that Emily is longing for a bit of adventure and so, when Nia is asked to take the Sodor Rangers up to Callan Castle, Rebecca suggests that Emily do the job instead. Emily ends up derailed and lost in the fog. But when Nia comes to the rescue she finds an exciting girls-together campsite! Emily and Nia camp out all night with the Sodor Rangers! The two friends return in the morning with an exciting story to tell!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Thomas’ new Italian friends, Lorenzo and his coach Beppe, do everything together, but one day, Lorenzo decides he’d like to do things by himself for a change. Beppe is hurt when Lorenzo leaves him behind so he can deliver the legendary Opera Star, Bella Canto, to a music festival. Lorenzo meets his match in Bella - she’s a soloist and a diva who wants to do everything by herself, her way! She doesn’t let Lorenzo join in with her singing and demands he take her a different route. Not wanting to let her down, Lorenzo follows her command, but without his trusty Beppe – and his sense of direction – they end up lost! Luckily, Beppe knows that, deep down, his friend needs him, so comes to rescue and the pair are reunited once more.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: As every year, Maria is set to take part in the pizza contest. But she sprains her wrist at the last moment and, unable to cook, cant participate. So David asks Grisu to cook in her stead. Its the perfect mission for Grisu, who loves pizza (and his father even more). Maria instructs him – and Stella – on how to make the Pizza Nonna, according to her grandmothers recipe. But things go haywire, Grisu unwittingly ends up tied to the ceiling fan, spinning fast, kicking everything and making a mess in the kitchen, plus he burns the recipe. As all hope seems lost, Grisu, who never gives up, has Maria sing a lullaby, which makes her remember the recipe. Thanks to that, they make the best pizza ever and go on to win the contest.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Toramento has to decorate Dragontown with flowers for its yearly ball. But as he got the flowers delivered too late, he wont be able to finish his task on time. So David asks Grisu to help out Toramento and be his assistant gardener. The young dragon is in charge of making flowerbed depicting a volcano in the town square – even though Fume would rather have his son use cactuses instead of flowers. Things dont go exactly as planned. First, the soil is too hard, and then Thingy unearths most flowers Grisu and Stella have managed to plant.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Big Nutbrown Hare teaches Little Nutbrown Hare and his friends to play hide-and-seek, but the boisterous little hare finds it hard to stay still and quiet, especially when the Spring meadow is full of birds, butterflies and lizards to chase. When he does manage to stay still and quiet he finds the creatures of the meadow come to him… even very shy ones.

programme.title: Eugene Onegin by Tchaikovsky at la Monnaie
programme.desc: Eugene Onegin‘Lyric scenes’ in three acts by Piotr Illich Tchaikovsky (1840 – 1893)Libretto by Piotr Illich Tchaikovsky and Konstantin Stepanovich Shilovsky after PushkinFirst performance Moscow, Maliy Theatre, 29 March 1879

programme.title: Rachmaninov revisited
programme.desc: Celebrated in his day not only as a great composer, Sergei Rachmaninov was also admired as an outstanding pianist who was a peerless interpreter of his own works including the piano concerti and the Rhapsody on a Theme by Paganini.It is well known that he was in effect the sole pianist capable of performing his most demanding Third Piano Concerto and his performances and recording of the concerto came to be considered as the definitive ones. The relationship between performance, interpretation, and Rachmaninov’s own life is addressed in this film by young pianists. They explore the evolution of interpretation over the past few decades with brief excerpts of recordings by Rachmaninov as contrasted with contemporary performances by today’s well-known young pianists as they comment on the differences (or similarities) of their approach.Subtitles available for this program with your remote control

programme.title: Verdi : Requiem – Claudio Abbado, Berliner Philharmoniker

programme.title: Dietrich Fischer-Dieskau : Dernières paroles
programme.desc: The great German baritone Dietrich Fischer-Dieskau was greatly admired for his interpretive insight, note-perfect control of the tonal qualities, and shadings of color in his voice, for exceptional rhythmic sense and impeccable diction. His reputation as a lieder singer is so high – he had a repertoire of more than 3.000 songs – that it is easy to forget his extensive list of operatic roles. In this conversation Fischer-Dieskau reveals for the last time on camera the secrets of his outstanding career. His ‘Last Words’ provide a deep insight into the extraordinary artistic life of one of the most famous and prolific lieder singers of our time. Dietrich Fischer-Dieskau died in May 2012 at the age of 86.Subtitles available for this program with your remote control
